title: Fix crashes in v3.0
body:
This pull request fixes the crashes that affect the most users in version 3.0:
1. `NetworkOnMainThreadException` in `BarrierFreeFacilitiesActivity`(fixed by moving the network call to a background thread)
2. Situations where view was null in `StudyRoomsActivity` (fixed by making it nullable; it’s not used anyway)
3. Crash when `CalendarController.QueryLocationsService` could not be started (convert `IntentService` into `JobIntentService`, which don’t experience the same crashes)

body:
I usually see this when the station is Theresienstraße, but I am quite sure I don't get any results in Garching either

MVV card shows me the name of the closest public transport station and the next few departures

## Actual Result
Only the name of the station is shown in the card

### Environment
* Phone: Pixel XL
* OS version: Android 9
* TUM Campus App version: v3.1-dev
* Language: English

title: Daggerization
label: [Label(name="Improvement")]
body:
I know that you’ve all missed my way-too-large PRs lately, so... THEY’RE BACK! 😉

This PR introduces dependency injection via Dagger into the app, which offers the following advantages: 
1. Classes no longer have to create their own dependencies, which is more in line with the Single Responsibility Principle
2. Better testability by injecting fake components instead of the real ones, e.g. for testing a ViewModel
3. Everyone on the project can learn about dependency injection 😊

There’s more to do besides this PR: 
1. Create subcomponents out of `AppComponent`, which are used in single Activities rather than throughout the entire app
2. Make more classes use dependency injection instead of creating dependencies themselves
3. Properly test that nothing broke (that’s why we have betas, right?)

These remaining tasks should be addressed in future PRs.

title: Merge event details with tu film details
body:
## Issue
This fixes the following issue(s): #1199 
- [x] show buy button, number of tickets and full location in KinoActivity
- [x] open KinoActivity when clicking on event that is a movie
- [x] don't show an extra card for tu film events in the MainActivity (already has a FilmCard for the next movie)
- [x] indicate that tickets are available in the app on FilmCard
- [x] increases movie poster size slightly

Also fixes #1206 
Visit website button is visible (and working) again (db had field for url but wasn't annotated with serialised name) --> only visible now for non tu film events

## Screenshot
![screenshot_20181115-145713](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/16260112/48557847-207e3980-e8e8-11e8-82bd-47946cbfe6be.png)

## Why this is useful for all students
Showing the ticket information in the KinoActivity will make more students aware that they can buy tickets via the app

## TODO
- [x] add start time to KinoActivity
- [x] remove multiple workarounds via URL to check which event belongs to which kino item (@kordianbruck a reference from backend in the event will make this a lot nicer)

title: Rewrite FCM push notification code
body:
Considering @kordianbruck's unreviewed, directly-to-master hotfix at 1 am in c6b895a :see_no_evil: 
![](https://media1.tenor.com/images/6ac220e7d7e9cba9af043abe82c75ac1/tenor.gif?itemid=4280622)


 I decided to rewrite the whole FCM Notifications code. 

Also GenericNotification was a really bad name, since "Notification" is usually used for local Android notifications. By calling it the de-facto standard "push" notifications (thanks :apple:), instead of :cloud: messaging (what does this even mean?), I think I also clarified the whole naming confusion.

title: TicketSale: View improvements
label: [Label(name="User experience :ok_hand:")]
body:
So now that we have a few ticktes in the view, there are a few improvements, that seem kind of obvious and that would be great to implement:
- [ ] Images can also be vertical, in a 9:16 format. The overview could somehow limit the height and shrink those, but keep the 16:9 overall size in terms of height.
- [ ] On the details page, the image is kind of big right now, maybe show 70% but make it scrollable if the user wants to see the full size image
- [x] On the start page we now have the events and tu film right next to each other. Best option would be, to display the ticket if there is one, otherwise just display the news item
- [x] It would be great, if we could link from the event to the tu film - let me know, if you need a reference from the backend for this
- [x] Is the address necessary on the overview?
- [x] Make the banner part of the scrollable view in the overview

Thanks Till for taking up this task - cause I really suck at UI :hankey:

title: TicketSale: Terms of Service
label: [Label(name="Feature :tada:"), Label(name="High Priority :fire_engine:")]
body:
We need to add a link to the terms of service, that the user has to check a checkbox before clicking on buy in the PaymentActivity.

For the TU-Film this is: https://www.tu-film.de/pages/view/nutzungsbedingungen

You can get this URL and the stripe public key from this new API endpoint: https://app.tum.de/Api/event/ticket/payment/1/

Goals: 
- [x] Add checkbox with "I agree to the following conditions" to payment activity
- [x] Use the stripe public key from the API instead of hard coding it

title: Bump robolectric from 3.8 to 4.0.1
label: [Label(name="dependencies")]
body:
Bumps [robolectric](https://github.com/robolectric/robolectric) from 3.8 to 4.0.1.
Release notes *Sourced from [robolectric's releases](https://github.com/robolectric/robolectric/releases).* > Robolectric 4.0.1 fixes several bugs in 4.0: > ## Bug Fixes > * NPE in `PackageParser` in binary resources mode [issue #4026]. > * `Activity.getLifecycle().getCurrentState()==CREATED` although activity is resumed [issue #4038]. > * 4.0 migration tool not working [issue #4052]. > > ## Known Issues > * Android Gradle Plugin may report the following warning, which may be safely ignored: `WARNING: The option setting 'android.enableUnitTestBinaryResources=true' is experimental and unsupported.` > > Use Robolectric: > > ``` groovy > testCompile "org.robolectric:robolectric:4.0.1" > ``` > > [Getting Started](http://robolectric.org/getting-started/) | [Migrating](http://robolectric.org/migrating/#migrating-to-40) | [Report Issues](https://github-redirect.dependabot.com/robolectric/robolectric/issues). Enjoy! > > Robolectric 4.0 brings support for the Android P (SDK 28) release, new and improved support and testing APIs for dozens of Android classes, initial support for some `androidx-test` APIs, and a complete rewrite of the resource handling code making it behave much more like a real Android device. > > With the major version number bump to 4.0, we're making changes to some public APIs, detailed below. Check out the [migration notes](http://robolectric.org/migrating/#migrating-to-40) and use the new [automated migration tool](http://robolectric.org/automated-migration/) to help convert your existing tests to be compatible with Robolectric 4.0. > > ## API Changes > * Most `[**Implementation**](https://github.com/Implementation)` methods in shadow classes are now `protected` instead of `public`. Tests should always prefer to call SDK methods directly on Android classes rather than on their shadows [issue #4007]. > * `RuntimeEnvironment.application` has been deprecated, use `androidx.test.core.app.ApplicationProvider.getApplicationContext()` instead. > * `AutoCloseable` is now supported. In earlier versions of Robolectric, try-with-resources blocks would fail to call `close()` on the resource. > * Bumped Android P to build 4913185. > > ## Resources > In conjunction with Android Studio 3.2, Robolectric can now use resources processed using the Android build toolchain, and loads and handles those resources using the same logic as on an actual Android device. Robolectric’s old idiosyncratic resource handling mode is still available for projects not yet using the latest version of the build toolchain, but is now deprecated. > > ## New and improved SDK support and testing APIs for numerous Android classes, including: > * `ActivityManager.getAppTasks()` > * `ApplicationPackageManager` content providers, `canRequestPackageInstalls()` > * `AppOpsManager` > * `AsyncQueryHandler` > * `AudioManager.getActivePlaybackConfiguration()` > * `BackupManager` > * `BluetoothAdapter` profile connection state and bond state > * `Build.getSerial()` > * `CameraManager` and `CameraCharacteristics` > * `Camera.Parameters` preview sizes > * `CarrierConfigManager.getConfigForSubId()` > * `ConnectivityManager` support for `NetworkCapabilities`, `requestNetwork()`. > * `ContentResolver.openOutputStream()`, 'getSyncAdapterTypes()' > * `Context.bindServiceAsUser()` > * `DevicePolicyManager.setUserProvisioningState()` > * `EuiccManager` > * `FontFamily` > * Improvements to `AccessibilityNodeInfo` > * `NotificationManager` support for `AutomaticZenRule`s > ... (truncated)
Commits - [`768e10d`](https://github.com/robolectric/robolectric/commit/768e10d210b0f01db4ead665636ec3a9893af142) Bump version to 4.0.1. - [`c624ca1`](https://github.com/robolectric/robolectric/commit/c624ca17163e631fb5520352544a8f02a66737c3) Merge pull request [#4060](https://github-redirect.dependabot.com/robolectric/robolectric/issues/4060) from robolectric/fix-4052-migration - [`06217f5`](https://github.com/robolectric/robolectric/commit/06217f54dac7e774161df1e9c314d487e55ae366) Bump to errorprone 2.3.2. - [`f1adfc3`](https://github.com/robolectric/robolectric/commit/f1adfc325ab8b09cdb8018365b2706f1f4bb66cc) Fix overlapping replacement issues and broken tests. - [`296ec44`](https://github.com/robolectric/robolectric/commit/296ec444757d5aa4d757a47d1ce5c217647ddb54) Fix imports - [`7ab9e9e`](https://github.com/robolectric/robolectric/commit/7ab9e9e4302bd9bbe4abbf68977a3c7813e1a19b) Fix bugs in migrator, ish. - [`7859a99`](https://github.com/robolectric/robolectric/commit/7859a99a9c6ce3fb8344b3318d770bbd7d690443) ByteBucketArray should return non-null default for missing entries. - [`6d994ec`](https://github.com/robolectric/robolectric/commit/6d994ec24d5a7bc324f50a16768b05d484faec9a) Fix gradle build - [`508fae7`](https://github.com/robolectric/robolectric/commit/508fae70ba833fe4a3b734495036a46a96d9fd11) Fix ActivityController to invoke Instrumentation#callActivityOn* method prope... - [`0c2d238`](https://github.com/robolectric/robolectric/commit/0c2d238252b8ad9043fd6dbfb92b244f35ce92fd) Open for dev on 4.0.x. - Additional commits viewable in [compare view](https://github.com/robolectric/robolectric/compare/robolectric-bazel-3.8...robolectric-4.0.1)

title: Bump robolectric from 3.8 to 4.0.1 in /app
label: [Label(name="dependencies")]
body:
Bumps [robolectric](https://github.com/robolectric/robolectric) from 3.8 to 4.0.1.
Release notes *Sourced from [robolectric's releases](https://github.com/robolectric/robolectric/releases).* > Robolectric 4.0.1 fixes several bugs in 4.0: > ## Bug Fixes > * NPE in `PackageParser` in binary resources mode [issue #4026]. > * `Activity.getLifecycle().getCurrentState()==CREATED` although activity is resumed [issue #4038]. > * 4.0 migration tool not working [issue #4052]. > > ## Known Issues > * Android Gradle Plugin may report the following warning, which may be safely ignored: `WARNING: The option setting 'android.enableUnitTestBinaryResources=true' is experimental and unsupported.` > > Use Robolectric: > > ``` groovy > testCompile "org.robolectric:robolectric:4.0.1" > ``` > > [Getting Started](http://robolectric.org/getting-started/) | [Migrating](http://robolectric.org/migrating/#migrating-to-40) | [Report Issues](https://github-redirect.dependabot.com/robolectric/robolectric/issues). Enjoy! > > Robolectric 4.0 brings support for the Android P (SDK 28) release, new and improved support and testing APIs for dozens of Android classes, initial support for some `androidx-test` APIs, and a complete rewrite of the resource handling code making it behave much more like a real Android device. > > With the major version number bump to 4.0, we're making changes to some public APIs, detailed below. Check out the [migration notes](http://robolectric.org/migrating/#migrating-to-40) and use the new [automated migration tool](http://robolectric.org/automated-migration/) to help convert your existing tests to be compatible with Robolectric 4.0. > > ## API Changes > * Most `[**Implementation**](https://github.com/Implementation)` methods in shadow classes are now `protected` instead of `public`. Tests should always prefer to call SDK methods directly on Android classes rather than on their shadows [issue #4007]. > * `RuntimeEnvironment.application` has been deprecated, use `androidx.test.core.app.ApplicationProvider.getApplicationContext()` instead. > * `AutoCloseable` is now supported. In earlier versions of Robolectric, try-with-resources blocks would fail to call `close()` on the resource. > * Bumped Android P to build 4913185. > > ## Resources > In conjunction with Android Studio 3.2, Robolectric can now use resources processed using the Android build toolchain, and loads and handles those resources using the same logic as on an actual Android device. Robolectric’s old idiosyncratic resource handling mode is still available for projects not yet using the latest version of the build toolchain, but is now deprecated. > > ## New and improved SDK support and testing APIs for numerous Android classes, including: > * `ActivityManager.getAppTasks()` > * `ApplicationPackageManager` content providers, `canRequestPackageInstalls()` > * `AppOpsManager` > * `AsyncQueryHandler` > * `AudioManager.getActivePlaybackConfiguration()` > * `BackupManager` > * `BluetoothAdapter` profile connection state and bond state > * `Build.getSerial()` > * `CameraManager` and `CameraCharacteristics` > * `Camera.Parameters` preview sizes > * `CarrierConfigManager.getConfigForSubId()` > * `ConnectivityManager` support for `NetworkCapabilities`, `requestNetwork()`. > * `ContentResolver.openOutputStream()`, 'getSyncAdapterTypes()' > * `Context.bindServiceAsUser()` > * `DevicePolicyManager.setUserProvisioningState()` > * `EuiccManager` > * `FontFamily` > * Improvements to `AccessibilityNodeInfo` > * `NotificationManager` support for `AutomaticZenRule`s > ... (truncated)
Commits - [`768e10d`](https://github.com/robolectric/robolectric/commit/768e10d210b0f01db4ead665636ec3a9893af142) Bump version to 4.0.1. - [`c624ca1`](https://github.com/robolectric/robolectric/commit/c624ca17163e631fb5520352544a8f02a66737c3) Merge pull request [#4060](https://github-redirect.dependabot.com/robolectric/robolectric/issues/4060) from robolectric/fix-4052-migration - [`06217f5`](https://github.com/robolectric/robolectric/commit/06217f54dac7e774161df1e9c314d487e55ae366) Bump to errorprone 2.3.2. - [`f1adfc3`](https://github.com/robolectric/robolectric/commit/f1adfc325ab8b09cdb8018365b2706f1f4bb66cc) Fix overlapping replacement issues and broken tests. - [`296ec44`](https://github.com/robolectric/robolectric/commit/296ec444757d5aa4d757a47d1ce5c217647ddb54) Fix imports - [`7ab9e9e`](https://github.com/robolectric/robolectric/commit/7ab9e9e4302bd9bbe4abbf68977a3c7813e1a19b) Fix bugs in migrator, ish. - [`7859a99`](https://github.com/robolectric/robolectric/commit/7859a99a9c6ce3fb8344b3318d770bbd7d690443) ByteBucketArray should return non-null default for missing entries. - [`6d994ec`](https://github.com/robolectric/robolectric/commit/6d994ec24d5a7bc324f50a16768b05d484faec9a) Fix gradle build - [`508fae7`](https://github.com/robolectric/robolectric/commit/508fae70ba833fe4a3b734495036a46a96d9fd11) Fix ActivityController to invoke Instrumentation#callActivityOn* method prope... - [`0c2d238`](https://github.com/robolectric/robolectric/commit/0c2d238252b8ad9043fd6dbfb92b244f35ce92fd) Open for dev on 4.0.x. - Additional commits viewable in [compare view](https://github.com/robolectric/robolectric/compare/robolectric-bazel-3.8...robolectric-4.0.1)

[![Dependabot compatibility score](https://api.dependabot.com/badges/compatibility_score?dependency-name=org.robolectric:robolectric&package-manager=gradle&previous-version=3.8&new-version=4.0.1)](https://dependabot.com/compatibility-score.html?dependency-name=org.robolectric:robolectric&package-manager=gradle&previous-version=3.8&new-version=4.0.1) Dependabot will resolve any conflicts with this PR as long as you don't alter it yourself. title: Use WorkManager instead of JobIntentServices
body:
this fixes #914

WorkManager has much more robust scheduling strategies, with automatic retry strategies built-in. 
I also noticed, that the Wifi measurements were collected, but never uploaded, so I removed that logic altogether.

What do you think?
Did I miss any "background work", which we do with threads / background loopers and should be done with WorkManager?

title: StartupActivity AlertDialog unreadable
label: [Label(name="Bug :bug:"), Label(name="User experience :ok_hand:")]
body:
When the user denies the location permission, we show an AlertDialog at startup.

It seems like the dialog has white text on white background:

![screenshot_1540989401](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/5686284/47788539-4c0efa80-dd12-11e8-9d2e-4e14cd23a05f.png)

title: Fix bug where events of last day in month were not displayed
label: [Label(name="Bug :bug:")]
body:
This commit fixes a problem where the events of the last day of a month were not displayed. The reason was that we used a `DateTime` object with the current time to limit the range of events. By definition, all remaining events in the month are _after_ this time, so they were filtered out. 

Now, we’re explicitly setting the time to the start of the first day and to the end of the last day for the start time and the end time of the range, respectively.

body:
## Issue

locations should match

## Actual Result

locations don't match

## Problem

locations don't match

fix it ;) I guess TCA only shows the location of the building

### Environment

* OS version: ...
* TUM Campus App version: 2.3
* Language: de

Updates `kotlin-stdlib-jdk7` from 1.2.71 to 1.3.0
Release notes *Sourced from [kotlin-stdlib-jdk7's releases](https://github.com/JetBrains/kotlin/releases).* > ## 1.3.0 > ### IDE > > - [`KT-25429`](https://youtrack.jetbrains.com/issue/KT-25429) Replace update channel in IDE plugin > - [`KT-27793`](https://youtrack.jetbrains.com/issue/KT-27793) kotlinx.android.synthetic is unresolved on project reopening > > ### IDE. Inspections and Intentions > > - [`KT-27619`](https://youtrack.jetbrains.com/issue/KT-27619) Inspection "Invalid property key" should check whether reference is soft or not > > ## Previous releases > > This release also includes the fixes and improvements from the [previous releases](https://github.com/JetBrains/kotlin/blob/1.3.0/ChangeLog.md). > > ## 1.3 RC4 > ### Compiler > > #### Fixes > > - [`KT-26858`](https://youtrack.jetbrains.com/issue/KT-26858) Inline class access to private companion object value fails with NSME > - [`KT-27030`](https://youtrack.jetbrains.com/issue/KT-27030) Non-capturing lambda in inline class members fails with internal error (NPE in genClosure) > - [`KT-27031`](https://youtrack.jetbrains.com/issue/KT-27031) Inline extension lambda in inline class fun fails with internal error (wrong bytecode generated) > - [`KT-27033`](https://youtrack.jetbrains.com/issue/KT-27033) Anonymous object in inline class fun fails with internal error (NPE in generateObjectLiteral/.../writeOuterClassAndEnclosingMethod) > - [`KT-27096`](https://youtrack.jetbrains.com/issue/KT-27096) AnalyzerException: Error at instruction 71: Expected I, but found . when function takes unsigned type with default value and returns nullable inline class > - [`KT-27130`](https://youtrack.jetbrains.com/issue/KT-27130) Suspension point is inside a critical section regression > - [`KT-27132`](https://youtrack.jetbrains.com/issue/KT-27132) CCE when inline class is boxed > - [`KT-27258`](https://youtrack.jetbrains.com/issue/KT-27258) Report diagnostic for suspension point inside critical section for crossinline suspend lambdas > - [`KT-27393`](https://youtrack.jetbrains.com/issue/KT-27393) Incorrect inline class type coercion in '==' with generic call > - [`KT-27484`](https://youtrack.jetbrains.com/issue/KT-27484) Suspension points in synchronized blocks checker crashes > - [`KT-27502`](https://youtrack.jetbrains.com/issue/KT-27502) Boxed inline class backed by Any is not unboxed before method invocation > - [`KT-27526`](https://youtrack.jetbrains.com/issue/KT-27526) Functional type with inline class argument and suspend modified expects unboxed value while it is boxed > - [`KT-27615`](https://youtrack.jetbrains.com/issue/KT-27615) Double wrap when inline class is printing if it was obtained from list/map > - [`KT-27620`](https://youtrack.jetbrains.com/issue/KT-27620) Report error when using value of kotlin.Result type as an extension receiver with safe call > > ### IDE > > - [`KT-27298`](https://youtrack.jetbrains.com/issue/KT-27298) Deadlock on project open > - [`KT-27329`](https://youtrack.jetbrains.com/issue/KT-27329) Migration doesn't work for kts projects when versions are stored in kt files inside buildSrc directory > - [`KT-27355`](https://youtrack.jetbrains.com/issue/KT-27355) Assertion error from light classes (expected callable member was null) for type alias in JvmMultifileClass annotated file > - [`KT-27456`](https://youtrack.jetbrains.com/issue/KT-27456) New Project wizard: Kotlin (Multiplatform Library): consider generating source files with different names to work around KT-21186 > - [`KT-27473`](https://youtrack.jetbrains.com/issue/KT-27473) "Gradle sync failed: Already disposed: Module: 'moduleName-app_commonMain'" on reimport of a multiplatform project with Android target between different IDEs > - [`KT-27485`](https://youtrack.jetbrains.com/issue/KT-27485) Gradle import failed with "Already disposed" error on reopening of a multiplatform project with Android target > - [`KT-27572`](https://youtrack.jetbrains.com/issue/KT-27572) ISE: "Could not generate LightClass for entry declared in " at CompilationErrorHandler.lambda$static$0() > > ### IDE. Android > > - [`KT-26975`](https://youtrack.jetbrains.com/issue/KT-26975) CNFDE KotlinAndroidGradleOrderEnumerationHandler$FactoryImpl in AS 3.3 with Kotlin 1.3.0-rc-51 > - [`KT-27451`](https://youtrack.jetbrains.com/issue/KT-27451) `main` target platform selection is not working in a multiplatform project with Android and JVM targets in Android Studio > > ### IDE. title: Fix SQLiteConstraintException with non-unique Insert
Remove Guava dependency
body:
Kotlin already solves a lot of things, Guava provided helpers for.

To reduce the number of dependencies, I'd like to remove Guava from our dependencies. With Proguard enabled, Guava has negligible impact on APK code size, but it should still be nice to shed some legacy code.

title: Fix some minor rawtype and misc Kotlin warnings
body:
I blame @thellmund for introducing them in #1167 :gun: 
It's nothing major, but I'd like to keep the warnings count low :)

title: Use AndroidX instead of old SupportLibrary
body:
Google recently refactored the android support libraries to the AndroidX
namespace with different, per artifact versioning.
see: https://android-developers.googleblog.com/2018/05/hello-world-androidx.html
and https://developer.android.com/jetpack/androidx/

This commit gets rid of `android.support.*` and uses `androidx.*` instead.
Also since PhotoView recently moved to AndroidX, it now builds unlike in #1108

title: Calendar: too much spacing
label: [Label(name="User experience :ok_hand:")]
body:
We are getting complaints, that the calendar is not the best, as with many events, nothing gets displayed. Could we maybe reduce the spacing inside? Reduce font size?
The Dayview seems okaish. The Week view is really bad. Other ideas?

![screenshot_2018-10-26-10-41-48](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/298860/47555760-ec2ce400-d90c-11e8-8dce-7eb4ced4f663.jpg)
![screenshot_2018-10-26-10-40-50](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/298860/47555761-ecc57a80-d90c-11e8-8226-1c1d93191d47.jpg)

title: NextLectureCard only appears after reset
label: [Label(name="Bug :bug:")]
body:
> Schickes neues Design! 
> Ein kleiner Bug in der App: Die Karte für die aktuelle bzw nächste Lehrveranstaltung wird
> bei Neustart der App nicht angezeigt, obwohl sie in den Einstellungen aktiviert wurde. 
> Erst nach Wiederherstellen aller Karten oder öffnen des Kalenders erscheint die Karte.

title: Bump robolectric from 3.8 to 4.0
label: [Label(name="dependencies")]
body:
Bumps [robolectric](https://github.com/robolectric/robolectric) from 3.8 to 4.0.
Release notes *Sourced from [robolectric's releases](https://github.com/robolectric/robolectric/releases).* > Robolectric 4.0 brings support for the Android P (SDK 28) release, new and improved support and testing APIs for dozens of Android classes, initial support for some `androidx-test` APIs, and a complete rewrite of the resource handling code making it behave much more like a real Android device. > > With the major version number bump to 4.0, we're making changes to some public APIs, detailed below. Check out the [migration notes](http://robolectric.org/migrating/#migrating-to-40) and use the new [automated migration tool](http://robolectric.org/automated-migration/) to help convert your existing tests to be compatible with Robolectric 4.0. > > ## API Changes > * Most `[**Implementation**](https://github.com/Implementation)` methods in shadow classes are now `protected` instead of `public`. Tests should always prefer to call SDK methods directly on Android classes rather than on their shadows [issue #4007]. > * `RuntimeEnvironment.application` has been deprecated, use `androidx.test.core.app.ApplicationProvider.getApplicationContext()` instead. > * `AutoCloseable` is now supported. In earlier versions of Robolectric, try-with-resources blocks would fail to call `close()` on the resource. > * Bumped Android P to build 4913185. > > ## Resources > In conjunction with Android Studio 3.2, Robolectric can now use resources processed using the Android build toolchain, and loads and handles those resources using the same logic as on an actual Android device. Robolectric’s old idiosyncratic resource handling mode is still available for projects not yet using the latest version of the build toolchain, but is now deprecated. > > ## New and improved SDK support and testing APIs for numerous Android classes, including: > * `ActivityManager.getAppTasks()` > * `ApplicationPackageManager` content providers, `canRequestPackageInstalls()` > * `AppOpsManager` > * `AsyncQueryHandler` > * `AudioManager.getActivePlaybackConfiguration()` > * `BackupManager` > * `BluetoothAdapter` profile connection state and bond state > * `Build.getSerial()` > * `CameraManager` and `CameraCharacteristics` > * `Camera.Parameters` preview sizes > * `CarrierConfigManager.getConfigForSubId()` > * `ConnectivityManager` support for `NetworkCapabilities`, `requestNetwork()`. > * `ContentResolver.openOutputStream()`, 'getSyncAdapterTypes()' > * `Context.bindServiceAsUser()` > * `DevicePolicyManager.setUserProvisioningState()` > * `EuiccManager` > * `FontFamily` > * Improvements to `AccessibilityNodeInfo` > * `NotificationManager` support for `AutomaticZenRule`s > * `PackageManager.checkPermission()` checks `PackageInfo.requestedPermissionsFlags` to determine if a permission is granted. > * `Path`, `PathMeasure`, and `PathParser` > * `SensorManager` > * `Service.stopSelfResult()` > * `ShadowSensor.newInstance()` > * `Sms` > * `SoundPool` now records more details when `play()` is called. > * `StorageManager` test API for adding volumes. > * `SubscriptionManager.getActiveSubscriptionInfoForSimSlotIndex()`, `getActiveSubscriptionInfoCount()` etc., 'getDefaultSubscriptionId()' > * `SystemClock.elapsedRealtimeNanos()` and `currentNetworkTimeMillis()` > * `TelecomManager.silenceRinger()` > * `TelephonyManager.getSubscriberId()`, `getSimSerialNumber()`, 'getVoiceNetworkType()' > * `TextToSpeech` > * `Tile` and `TileService` minimal implementation > * `TimeZoneFinder` > * `UsbManager` > * `UserManager` now supports multiple users. > ... (truncated)
Commits - [`1a07902`](https://github.com/robolectric/robolectric/commit/1a07902f0d65e44736038f734bab463520d06664) Bump version to 4.0. - [`3eb0404`](https://github.com/robolectric/robolectric/commit/3eb0404e0329bedceaf0ce2164f77a8b5cae1ad6) Merge pull request [#4049](https://github-redirect.dependabot.com/robolectric/robolectric/issues/4049) from robolectric/add-legacy-mode-warning - [`48a4120`](https://github.com/robolectric/robolectric/commit/48a4120fdbff7ad8ddf8cb1f4591b2b8ae7cd76d) Add legacy mode warning. - [`5a01d72`](https://github.com/robolectric/robolectric/commit/5a01d72ade259319f52c73c9ecd5329b6d09c5cd) Merge pull request [#4042](https://github-redirect.dependabot.com/robolectric/robolectric/issues/4042) from robolectric/remove-config-packagename - [`1ee74d1`](https://github.com/robolectric/robolectric/commit/1ee74d18eed1328a1b0c967d19301c7970fc4c36) Merge branch 'master' into remove-config-packagename - [`e93e606`](https://github.com/robolectric/robolectric/commit/e93e606000d4cf1a65fe9666e6ab568d9107a893) Fix ShadowPackageManagerTest#queryIntentActivities_ServiceMatch. - [`71eee81`](https://github.com/robolectric/robolectric/commit/71eee81fb72edebfe083f43e47387285c7eb0155) Bump version to 4.0-beta-4-SNAPSHOT. - [`ce171e4`](https://github.com/robolectric/robolectric/commit/ce171e415cf8a9d451e90179a8d1217b7e958e24) Bump version to 4.0-beta-3. - [`b36d012`](https://github.com/robolectric/robolectric/commit/b36d01289d3b88d1b94f32a94c4528c54e2ac64c) Merge pull request [#4044](https://github-redirect.dependabot.com/robolectric/robolectric/issues/4044) from robolectric/storage-manager - [`9da5276`](https://github.com/robolectric/robolectric/commit/9da52767bcd67a7561a09c7079e598c0821e5bab) Merge pull request [#4043](https://github-redirect.dependabot.com/robolectric/robolectric/issues/4043) from robolectric/sound-pool-play-details - Additional commits viewable in [compare view](https://github.com/robolectric/robolectric/compare/robolectric-bazel-3.8...robolectric-4.0)

Robolectric’s old idiosyncratic resource handling mode is still available for projects not yet using the latest version of the build toolchain, but is now deprecated. > > ## New and improved SDK support and testing APIs for numerous Android classes, including: > * `ActivityManager.getAppTasks()` > * `ApplicationPackageManager` content providers, `canRequestPackageInstalls()` > * `AppOpsManager` > * `AsyncQueryHandler` > * `AudioManager.getActivePlaybackConfiguration()` > * `BackupManager` > * `BluetoothAdapter` profile connection state and bond state > * `Build.getSerial()` > * `CameraManager` and `CameraCharacteristics` > * `Camera.Parameters` preview sizes > * `CarrierConfigManager.getConfigForSubId()` > * `ConnectivityManager` support for `NetworkCapabilities`, `requestNetwork()`. > * `ContentResolver.openOutputStream()`, 'getSyncAdapterTypes()' > * `Context.bindServiceAsUser()` > * `DevicePolicyManager.setUserProvisioningState()` > * `EuiccManager` > * `FontFamily` > * Improvements to `AccessibilityNodeInfo` > * `NotificationManager` support for `AutomaticZenRule`s > * `PackageManager.checkPermission()` checks `PackageInfo.requestedPermissionsFlags` to determine if a permission is granted. > * `Path`, `PathMeasure`, and `PathParser` > * `SensorManager` > * `Service.stopSelfResult()` > * `ShadowSensor.newInstance()` > * `Sms` > * `SoundPool` now records more details when `play()` is called. > * `StorageManager` test API for adding volumes. > * `SubscriptionManager.getActiveSubscriptionInfoForSimSlotIndex()`, `getActiveSubscriptionInfoCount()` etc., 'getDefaultSubscriptionId()' > * `SystemClock.elapsedRealtimeNanos()` and `currentNetworkTimeMillis()` > * `TelecomManager.silenceRinger()` > * `TelephonyManager.getSubscriberId()`, `getSimSerialNumber()`, 'getVoiceNetworkType()' > * `TextToSpeech` > * `Tile` and `TileService` minimal implementation > * `TimeZoneFinder` > * `UsbManager` > * `UserManager` now supports multiple users. > ... (truncated)

title: update mensa garching opening time
body:
## Issue

This fixes the following issue(s):
Mensa Garching has opened until 16:00, see [here](https://www.studentenwerk-muenchen.de/mensa/standorte-und-oeffnungszeiten/garching/).

title: Refactor ProgressActivity and related improvements
label: [Label(name="Improvement")]
body: For a more unified behavior (API access, error handling, lifecycle handling), I’ve moved more functionality out of `ActivityForAccessingTumOnline` and `ActivityForSearchingTumOnline` to `ProgressActivity`. The PR also contains some related improvements in `RoomFinderDetailsActivity`.

title: Prevent IllegalStateException (openEvent)
label: [Label(name="Bug :bug:")]
body:
## Issue
This fixes the following issue(s): #1151 

I was able to reproduce the exception when clicking on the back button and then immediately on an event.
Setting `mWeekView.setEventOnEventClickListener(null)` didn't seem to work but this does seem to prevent the crash.

title: Fix Exception caused by too many alarms
label: [Label(name="Bug :bug:")]
body:
this fixes #1162

We now persistently track the active alarms in the DB.
@thellmund voiced concerns about important Notifications, so I decided to not limit the creation of *single* notification alarms, but only when they are added in batch.

Also the Calendar and Transport notifications now only use up up to half of the remaining "space" for notifications, so there should always be space for the most important notifications.

title: Improve display of upcoming events via CalendarDetailsFragment
label: [Label(name="Improvement")]
body:
Instead of heading to CalendarActivity and displaying the CalendarDetailsFragment there, we display it directly in MainActivity. This way, the user can go back to browsing their feed more easily. 

The fragment now also contains a "Show in calendar" button, so that the user can open the CalendarActivity and perform actions on the event (such as edit and delete).

title: Catch on Card creation
label: [Label(name="Bug :bug:")]
body:
When a card crashes during creation, this leaves the home screen in a loading state. By catching those exceptions, we at least don't block from other cards being displayed, as one card is having troubles.

Related: https://www.support.tum.de/otrs/index.pl?Action=AgentTicketZoom;TicketID=3131883

title: SecurityException: Too many alarms registered
label: [Label(name="Bug :bug:")]
body:
@thellmund already tried to fix this issue with f5037b67eae1477da37c5656c523f060798a6a19, but that apparently didn't fix the issue.

I guess we need to keep track of the "active" notifications by manually counting how many are active. I.e. increment in `scheduleAlarm()` and decrement in `NotificationAlarmReceiver.onReceive()`

title: Feedback Topic
body:
Fix bug where changing the radio button would not actually change the topic of the feedback being sent.

Seemed to have slipped by when refactoring the code & review.

title: Stop sending Feedback Images if Feedback could not be created
label: [Label(name="Low Priority :man_shrugging:"), Label(name="Suggestion :telescope:")]
body:
`sendFeedback` in the `FeedbackActivity` currently does not abort sending the Images, if the initial request to send the feedback itself fails. Please refactor this, to first let the feedback to be created and just later on, it will create the images if the first request was successful. 

Also you are using the same callback for different requests. This makes it harder to understand, what the intention of the programmer was and requires me to take a deeper look into the code to understand what is going on. 

So, heres a checklist, I would love to see a similar commit structure:
- [x] Create a new helper class maybe, that only deals with business logic = controller
- [x] Pull code from the FeedbackActivity (=View) regarding sending the feedback and put it into the controller.
- [x] Improve the code to resolve the above comments and simply pass a model between controller and view

[I know we are not beeing super correct here, but Activities should rather not contain any logic]

title: Improve/Fix event titles
body:
## Issue
This fixes the following issue(s): #970 
- doesn't remove numbers outside of brackets anymore
- doesn't remove random capital letters from the end of the title anymore
- also removes lecture numbers in square brackets
- uses the formatted title in the bottom sheet as well (if lecture numbers are needed the user can look them up in My Lectures)

Tested for titles mentioned in the issue and my own events.

## Why this is useful for all students
Titles are displayed correctly again

title: Adds employee mode
body:
## Issue
This fixes the following issue(s): #1117 

- Hides lectures, grades and tuition fees for all people who are just employees.
- Adds setting to enable/disable employee mode for employees and employees that are also students.

- [x] make the change effective immediately without having to restart the app

title: Dark mode
label: [Label(name="Low Priority :man_shrugging:"), Label(name="User experience :ok_hand:")]

title: MainActivity.onAlwaysHideCard() crashes with index -1

body:

>length=10; index=-1
>CardAdapter.remove (CardAdapter.java:104)

probably do a sanity range check here

title: CalendarDetailsFragment crashes in error handling without context
label: [Label(name="Bug :bug:")]
body:

>Fragment CalendarDetailsFragment{d028044} not attached to a context.
>[...]CalendarDetailsFragment.handleDeleteEventError (CalendarDetailsFragment.kt:114)


`handleDeleteEventError()` should probably just swallow the exception, if the context is missing.

We probably should do `setOnEventClickListener(null)` in `onSaveInstanceState`

(0f8d3608a) > - `concurrent`: Added `doCancelStart` protected method to `AbstractService` (27bfe412b) >

title: Bump guava from 26.0-android to 27.0-android
label: [Label(name="dependencies")]
body:
Bumps [guava](https://github.com/google/guava) from 26.0-android to 27.0-android.
Release notes *Sourced from [guava's releases](https://github.com/google/guava/releases).* > ## 27.0 > ### Maven > > ```xml > > com.google.guava > guava > 27.0-jre > > 27.0-android > > ``` > > ### Javadoc > > - [27.0-jre](http://google.github.io/guava/releases/27.0-jre/api/docs/) > - [27.0-android](http://google.github.io/guava/releases/27.0-android/api/docs/) > > ### JDiff > > - [27.0-jre vs. 26.0-jre](http://google.github.io/guava/releases/27.0-jre/api/diffs/) > - [27.0-android vs. 26.0-android](http://google.github.io/guava/releases/27.0-android/api/diffs/) > - [27.0-android vs. 27.0-jre](http://google.github.io/guava/releases/27.0-android/api/androiddiffs/) > > ### Changelog > > **Important:** `ListenableFuture` is now available as a separate artifact (`com.google.guava:listenablefuture:1.0`) from the rest of Guava. As part of that change, Guava now has a real (needed at runtime) dependency on `com.google.guava:failureaccess:1.0`. For more details, see [this announcement](https://groups.google.com/d/topic/guava-announce/Km82fZG68Sw). (b62d52926) > > - `collect`: Added a `gap(Range)` method to `Range` that computes the `Range` that lies between them. (a9dd7098f) > - `net`: Added `HttpHeaders.EARLY_DATA`. (e074cf1a7) > - `net`: Added `MediaType.WASM_APPLICATION`. (0b3eb0f4e) > - `concurrent`: `AbstractFuture` doesn't expose `FluentFuture` APIs anymore. (0f8d3608a) > - `concurrent`: Added `doCancelStart` protected method to `AbstractService` (27bfe412b) >
Commits - See full diff in [compare view](https://github.com/google/guava/commits)

[![Dependabot compatibility score](https://api.dependabot.com/badges/compatibility_score?dependency-name=com.google.guava:guava&package-manager=gradle&previous-version=26.0-android&new-version=27.0-android)](https://dependabot.com/compatibility-score.html?dependency-name=com.google.guava:guava&package-manager=gradle&previous-version=26.0-android&new-version=27.0-android) Dependabot will resolve any conflicts with this PR as long as you don't alter it yourself. title: Fix a whole bunch of Java and Kotlin warnings
body:
Most notable changes include switching from deprecated calls to their new equivalents, depending on the OS version.

The eduroam config also had some questionable allowed ciphers:
```
GroupCipher.WEP40
GroupCipher.WEP104
PairwiseCipher.CCMP
PairwiseCipher.TKIP
```

Was there any reasoning behind allowing WEP and WPA1 connections?
They are rightfully deprecated, as they are insecure, so I just removed them.

title: remove deprecated FirebaseInstanceIdService
body:
This fixes #1110
I also replaced the "GCM" in the log messages, so filtering for "FCM" should now show all log messages for the tokens, to quickly check if the FCM registration worked.

title: InstantRun doesn't play nicely with shrinkResources.
body:
Disable it for now
This fixes the Circular dependency issue discussed in #1134

title: Fixes for 2.0 release
label: [Label(name="Bug :bug:")]
body:
This pull request fixes some issues encountered in the 2.0 release: 
- DNS error in MVVWidgetService
- Empty response error in MVVWidgetService

It also improves the following: 
- Properly cancel unfinished API calls when Activity is stopped
- Update style of ticket sale beta banner

title: TicketSale: hide buy button before event starts
label: [Label(name="Feature :tada:"), Label(name="High Priority :fire_engine:")]
body: We want the buy button to be hidden 4 hours before the start date of the event.

title: Ticket Sale Beta Info
body: ![screenshot_20181017-003305](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/298860/47051406-799d6500-d1a4-11e8-9156-4516b778ec8a.png)

title: Fix ActivityNotFoundException in InfoActivity
label: [Label(name="Bug :bug:")]
body:
The app crashes on the most recent beta when opening the Facebook link, when the Facebook App is installed with a ActivityNotFoundException.

Some Stackoverflow answers suggest (https://stackoverflow.com/a/24547437, https://stackoverflow.com/a/34564284), the FB App does not accept the URI we're trying to feed it since 2014 :hankey: 
I guess either nobody has the FB App installed anymore, or people simply do not like to click that link :man_shrugging: 

Do we even care? In the SupportCard we just open the browser in any case...

title: Room maps are not shown
label: [Label(name="Bug :bug:")]
body:
## Steps to Reproduce

1. Search for a room in the room finder
2. Click on one of the results

## Expected Result
Map of the room location is shown (and loading indicator if loading)

## Actual Result
Image is not shown/loading (screen stays white, no loading indicators)

### Environment
* Phone: Pixel XL
* OS version: Android Pie (9)
* TUM Campus App version: v2.0-beta6
* Language: English

title: Fix scroll for information and cafeteria activity
label: [Label(name="Bug :bug:")]
body:
## Issue

- Information activity was not scrollable and debug information was only half visible even on bigger devices
- the cafeteria activity was scrollable but the last line was cut off (I added some padding but other solutions are welcome)

title: Custom event: DatePicker one month off
label: [Label(name="Bug :bug:")]
body:
## Issue
When creating/editing a custom event the datePicker opened to one month in the future (although the date was right) and when selecting the current date the event was created one month the past

Now the date picker is showing the right month and the event is created on the day that the user selected.

title: Crashes if AppMeasurementService is missing
body:
## Suggested Enhancement
first of all thanks for this app.
I'm currently having a android phone with microg as replacement for gms services. Sadly, the campus app crashes on startup, because google's analytics are not available.
If possible I want to help getting this app running without gms by deactivating features or just skipping things like analytics as they are not needed for functionality.
I attached the startup log.
[log10-13-2018_20-41-10.txt](https://github.com/TCA-Team/TumCampusApp/files/2475760/log10-13-2018_20-41-10.txt)

### Environment
* OS version: Android 9.0 (Lineageos 16)
* TUM Campus App version: 1.6.2

title: Do not append token to request to create a new token
body:
## Issue

This fixes the following issue(s): #1131

title: Requesting a new token fails
label: [Label(name="Bug :bug:"), Label(name="High Priority :fire_engine:")]
body:
## Steps to Reproduce
Current Master =>
1. Open Wizard
2. Enter TUM ID
3. Click Next

## Expected Result
New token

## Actual Result
404 not found

## Problem
https://campus.tum.de/tumonline/wbservicesbasic.requestToken?pUsername=xxxx&pTokenName=xxx&pToken=

`pToken` should not be appended to the URL in this request

## Suggested Enhancement :sparkles:
Don't append for token request.

title: Navigation drawer completely white after going to Roomfinder via link
label: [Label(name="Bug :bug:")]
body:
## Steps to Reproduce

1. Click on a location in a calendar event
2. Click on one of the suggested rooms
3. Go back to the Roomfinder with the back button in the app bar
4. Click on the back button in the app bar again

## Actual Result
A completely empty (white) navigation drawer appears

title: Profile picture placeholder missing when logged in
label: [Label(name="Bug :bug:")]
body:
## Steps to Reproduce

1. Install App (picture placeholder visible when not logged in)
2. Log in with TUMonline (with an account without profile picture)
3. Open the navigation drawer

## Expected Result
The placeholder should be visible when the user does not have a profile picture in TUMonline

## Actual Result
Just a grey circle is shown.

![screenshot_20181007-110811](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/16260112/46580323-df5e5400-ca22-11e8-8b6f-e6a95d823b37.png)
![screenshot_20181007-111235](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/16260112/46580326-f00eca00-ca22-11e8-9349-5b2a3563a2b4.png)

title: Remove duplicate Events (different locations)
body:
- [x] Show only one event and list multiple locations in the calendar view
- [x] Show all the locations with their RoomFinder link beneath each other in the bottom sheet
- [x] Remove duplicates from NextLectureCard

## Related Issue 
#408
## Screenshot
![screenshot_20181007-113618](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/16260112/46732445-ce654b00-cc8d-11e8-8cdf-352fb52e70ea.png)

## Why this is useful for all students
Calendar is easier to read

title: Bump anko from 0.10.5 to 0.10.7
label: [Label(name="dependencies")]
body:
Bumps [anko](https://github.com/JetBrains/anko) from 0.10.5 to 0.10.7.
Release notes *Sourced from [anko's releases](https://github.com/JetBrains/anko/releases).* > ## Anko 0.10.7 > ## What's new > > This release has satellite with version number `0.10.7-rc13`. It's built with Kotlin `1.3-RC3` and release kotlinx.coroutines `0.30.1-eap13`. Please try it and feel free to provide any feedback. > > - Fixed "Bad lambda receiver type in verticalLayout's" [#673](https://github-redirect.dependabot.com/JetBrains/anko/issues/673) > - Satellite release 0.10.7-rc13 > > ## Anko 0.10.6 > ## What's new > > This release has satellite with version number `0.10.6-eap13`. It's built with Kotlin `1.3-M2` and release kotlinx.coroutines `0.26.0-eap13`. Please try it and feel free to provide any feedback. > > - Satellite release `0.10.6-eap-13` with release kotlinx.coroutines > - Libraries for Android 27 platform > - Loads of unnecessary symbols marked deprecated for removal ([#617](https://github-redirect.dependabot.com/JetBrains/anko/issues/617)) > - Snackbar extensions with View receiver ([#643](https://github-redirect.dependabot.com/JetBrains/anko/issues/643)) > - Change Snackbar's message type from String to CharSequence ([#655](https://github-redirect.dependabot.com/JetBrains/anko/issues/655))
Changelog *Sourced from [anko's changelog](https://github.com/Kotlin/anko/blob/master/CHANGELOG.md).* > ## Change Log
Commits - [`4296026`](https://github.com/Kotlin/anko/commit/4296026639c117361f32d92b7210efc5c033d0fc) Fix publication, avoid stubs dependency in pom - [`42bca13`](https://github.com/Kotlin/anko/commit/42bca136c2a2b900fcb972e8b8084dc6f6ca3726) Update kotlin version to 1.2.71 - [`37273d1`](https://github.com/Kotlin/anko/commit/37273d1da07639059d8100960e3679853aa24581) Update version to 0.10.7 - [`afd7339`](https://github.com/Kotlin/anko/commit/afd7339cae12c4bdd4d4459701ecb5aa5a7ffc38) Restore usage of _LinearLayout wrapper in platform-base - [`af66ca4`](https://github.com/Kotlin/anko/commit/af66ca4ff074174fe34ab7dd454058fbb52c7d61) Update bintray plugin to 1.8.4 - [`b3d2245`](https://github.com/Kotlin/anko/commit/b3d22457e23ae70b5d54a316f33b00138792cfc8) fix: Replace Snackbar's message type from String to CharSequence ([#655](https://github-redirect.dependabot.com/JetBrains/anko/issues/655)) - [`78cfe0a`](https://github.com/Kotlin/anko/commit/78cfe0a8708709ee7cf0d4b9ffb3b21e3ed548ab) Undeprecate foreachByIndex for list since compiler can't optimize foreach for... - [`9275223`](https://github.com/Kotlin/anko/commit/9275223304c0990f0f004475bad113db1cd479eb) Fix AnkoInternals useCursor - [`38cada1`](https://github.com/Kotlin/anko/commit/38cada163c3ef0bfadc929cd3d68b436d5f10d51) Target loads of unnecessary symbols for removal ([#617](https://github-redirect.dependabot.com/JetBrains/anko/issues/617)) - [`4671683`](https://github.com/Kotlin/anko/commit/4671683423e166a87e08de9f0645e5aed9d3887f) Snackbar View receiver and annotate string resources ([#643](https://github-redirect.dependabot.com/JetBrains/anko/issues/643)) - Additional commits viewable in [compare view](https://github.com/JetBrains/anko/compare/v0.10.5...v0.10.7)

title: More beta fixes
label: [Label(name="Bug :bug:"), Label(name="Improvement")]
body:
This pull request fixes some problems encountered in v2.0 beta 3 and 4: 
1. Introduces `EduroamFixCardViewHolder` and `NextLectureCardViewHolder` for greater stability and easier-to-understand code.
2. Updates the design of `NextLectureCard`, as the buttons on the right-hand side were both hard to hit (very small) and interfered with the options button. Now, we display a “show x more ...” button so that the user can expand the card and see up to four upcoming lectures.

---

Collapsed: 
![screenshot_20181005-212644](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/11819826/46556001-84731280-c8e5-11e8-8bfe-494d19a41008.png)

Expanded: 
![screenshot_20181005-212650](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/11819826/46556011-8b018a00-c8e5-11e8-8a28-2f74ace3866b.png)

title: Improve Employee experience
body: > Es sollten für Mitarbeiter nur die Features eingeblendet werden, die man auch tatsächlich benötigt bzw. verwenden kann. Wenn ich nicht zugleich auch Studi bin, brauche ich „Meine Noten“ oder „Rückmeldung“ nicht.

Add to news?

title: Redo StudyRoomsActivity
label: [Label(name="User experience :ok_hand:")]
body:
The whole studyrooms component was a bit tangled, so I decided to clean it up in a bit nicer Kotlin code.

Also the layout displaying the occupied / free rooms wasn't too nice:
* Room titles did not include any room number. So there's no way to quickly see, what room this status is for.
* The card layout used a LinearLayout, wasting the right half of the display with empty space.

We now display the room number in addition to the room's name.
Also we now display the room details side by side with the link to the RoomFinder, resulting in a bit more condensed layout

Old:
![screenshot_1538338191](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/5686284/46263036-28d20f00-c50a-11e8-9116-ce909a1022e5.png)

New:
![screenshot_1538342356](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/5686284/46263037-28d20f00-c50a-11e8-8328-3bf7c130ec7e.png)

title: Register NetworkCallbacks instead of deprecated CONNECTIVITY_ACTION broadcasts
body:
[API 28 deprecated](https://developer.android.com/reference/android/net/ConnectivityManager#CONNECTIVITY_ACTION) the Intent we were using.

Instead we should use the NetworkRequest / NetworkCallback API added in API 21.

title: Fix theming issues in BarrierFreeFacilitiesActivity
label: [Label(name="Bug :bug:")]
body: The recent redesign broke the theming in `BarrierFreeFacilitiesActivity`. This commit fixes this. It also improves the handling of empty responses by showing the `NoResultsAdapter`.

title: Improve offline experience
label: [Label(name="Bug :bug:"), Label(name="Improvement")]
body:
This pull request improves the offline experience of the app. 
1. Fixes a bug that prevented `MainActivity` from displaying cached content when offline. 
2. Removes `ConnectivityInterceptor` and `NoNetworkConnectionException`, as they prevented a proper use of the Retrofit cache.
3. If cached content is already being displayed, a failed refresh (e.g. due to being offline) now displays a `Snackbar` instead of a full-screen error view. This way, we don’t hide the cached content.

title: Fixes in MVV widget
label: [Label(name="Bug :bug:"), Label(name="Improvement")]
body:
This pull request was intended to only simplify `MVVSymbolView` (or rather: move from `MVVSymbolView` to `MVVSymbol`, as the former only encapsulated information and was never actually drawn to the screen). 

In the process, I noticed problems with the MVV widget (error “App isn’t installed”), which I also fixed in this pull request.

title: Clean up Utils packages and general code hygene
body:
API 28 deprecated [`NetworkInfo.isConnectedOrConnecting()`](https://developer.android.com/reference/android/net/NetworkInfo.html#isConnectedOrConnecting()), so I moved NetUtils to the newer API 21 `NetworkCapabilities`.
I also dropped all unused stuff from NetUtils :tada: 

Utils also had some deprecated items and more generally clunkyness and nullability problems because of Java.

I also transitioned TutionFeesActivity to use `ContextCompat.getColor()` and Kotlin

title: Fix event creation crash in v2.0 beta 2
label: [Label(name="Bug :bug:")]
body: This pull request fixes a crash that occurs when opening `CreateEventActivity` from `EventDetailsFragment`.

title: Fixes for 2.0 beta 2
body:
This pull request fixes a few bugs before beta 2 of version 2.0: 
- Wrong status bar color in Stripe activity
- Prevent crashes in StripePaymentActivity
- Prevent users from purchasing multiple event tickets

title: Add more calendar improvements
label: [Label(name="Improvement")]
body:
- A line now indicates the current time.
- A newly created event is now displayed immediately.
- A _today_ button now allows the user to quickly jump back to the current day.
- The overflow menu is simplified by reducing a single-item group to just the item itself.

title: Make tweaks to calendar design and behavior
label: [Label(name="Improvement")]
body:
- Update design of `CalendarDetailsFragment` (see below; let me know if something looks off on non-Pixel devices)
- Update to 2.0.1 of [my fork of WeekView](https://github.com/thellmund/Android-Week-View), which adds horizontal start and end margins
- Update behavior when creating a new calendar event (now uses the date last visible in the `WeekView` component)

title: Fix NetworkOnMainThreadException
label: [Label(name="Bug :bug:")]
body: This time, for real 🙈

title: Add null check in CalendarActivity to prevent IllegalArgumentException
label: [Label(name="Bug :bug:")]
body: This commit checks whether the list of events, as returned by the TUMonline API, is null. Only if it is not, it will invoke the methods that perform the scheduling of the corresponding notifications.

title: Fix JSON parsing bug in lecture appointments
label: [Label(name="Bug :bug:")]
body: This commit fixes a parsing exception for lecture appointments, resulting in wrong dates and times being displayed in the list of lecture appointments.

title: Fix several problems in chat
label: [Label(name="Improvement")]
body:
We currently experience several problems in the chat: 
- Messages are not sent successfully, due to a past model change in `ChatMessage`.
- Undelivered message were not marked as such, but continued to show a progress indicator. 
- Undelivered messages could not be re-sent.

This pull request addresses those problems and attempts to also refactor some parts of the architecture to provide easier-to-understand code.

title: Fix problem that resulted in a Bad Request to tickets API
label: [Label(name="Bug :bug:")]
body: While moving from `DeviceVerification` to `TUMCabeVerification`, I forgot to make an adjustment in `TUMCabeClient`, which resulted in `400 Bad Request` responses for requests to some ticket API endpoints. The reason was that I was not sending along some required data in the body.

title: Remove Claim/Slogen
label: [Label(name="good first issue :1st_place_medal:")]
body:
As per Feedback in this ticket: https://www.support.tum.de/otrs/index.pl?Action=AgentTicketZoom;TicketID=2910099

we want to be more inclusive, so just remove the claim: "For Students by students"

title: Minor UI adjustment in StartupActivity
body:
This pull request replaces the loading labels with a progress bar that is shown on the first app launch.

![screen shot 2018-09-17 at 23 47 23](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/11819826/45652187-1bf9f800-bad4-11e8-9801-834093de6944.png)

title: Make UI improvements in CreateEventActivity
label: [Label(name="Improvement")]
body:
This commit fixes some minor UI problems in `CreateEventActivity`.
1. Change text color to a darker variant. 
2. Add week day before the date.
3. Close keyboard before a picker dialog is opened (e.g. a date or time picker).

title: Fix minor problems
body:
- Crash in MainActivity when pressing the back button
- Rainbow logo was not shown even if logo was enable

title: Add TUM Uhrenturm drawing as drawer header background
body: ![whatsapp image 2018-09-17 at 22 15 28](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/11819826/45648218-1b5b6480-bac8-11e8-9541-2624e08cebcd.jpeg)

title: Add logout option and update settings design
label: [Label(name="Improvement")]
body: This commit adds a logout button (which replaces the option to clear the cache) and again applies the Material design to the settings (which got broken when updating to Support Library 28).

title: Fix problem where StartupActivity would not finish
label: [Label(name="Bug :bug:")]
body: This commit fixes a problem where `StartupActivity` would not finish. The reason was that the `BroadcastReceiver` was unregistered in `onPause()`. However, `onPause()` is invoked when the permission dialog pops up. I moved the unregistration of the `BroadcastReceiver` to `onStop()` to prevent this incorrect behavior.

title: Improve MVV card and details activity
label: [Label(name="Improvement")]
body: This pull request makes minor UI improvements and fixes an incorrect behavior in `TransportationDetailsActivity`. It also removes the `TransportationActivity` from the navigation drawer.

title: Fix NullPointerException in MVVWidget
label: [Label(name="Bug :bug:")]
body: Make `TransportController` non-static to avoid memory leaks (as it holds a reference to a `Context`) and move its initialization to `MVVWidget.onReceive()`, which is the main entry point of the widget.

title: Bump kotlin_version from 1.2.61 to 1.2.70
label: [Label(name="dependencies")]
body:
Bumps `kotlin_version` from 1.2.61 to 1.2.70. Updates `kotlin-gradle-plugin` from 1.2.61 to 1.2.70
Commits - See full diff in [compare view](https://github.com/JetBrains/kotlin/commits)

Updates `kotlin-stdlib-jdk7` from $kotlin_version to 1.2.70
Changelog *Sourced from [kotlin-stdlib-jdk7's changelog](https://github.com/JetBrains/kotlin/blob/master/ChangeLog.md).* > # CHANGELOG > > ## 1.3-M2 > > ### Compiler > > #### New Features > > - [`KT-6592`](https://youtrack.jetbrains.com/issue/KT-6592) Support local variable initialization in lambda arguments to some functions > - [`KT-19323`](https://youtrack.jetbrains.com/issue/KT-19323) Allow generic type parameter to have mixed constraints for [**InlineOnly**](https://github.com/InlineOnly) functions > - [`KT-24857`](https://youtrack.jetbrains.com/issue/KT-24857) Support compatibility wrappers for coroutines in compiler > - [`KT-25320`](https://youtrack.jetbrains.com/issue/KT-25320) Support limited conversions for constants to simplify interop for Kotlin/Native > - [`KT-25372`](https://youtrack.jetbrains.com/issue/KT-25372) Support JvmName on annotation property getters > - [`KT-25495`](https://youtrack.jetbrains.com/issue/KT-25495) Release contract DSL as experimental > - [`KT-25557`](https://youtrack.jetbrains.com/issue/KT-25557) Metadata that maps coroutine label to the file name and line number > - [`KT-25559`](https://youtrack.jetbrains.com/issue/KT-25559) Metadata that maps coroutine spilled state to local variables > - [`KT-25655`](https://youtrack.jetbrains.com/issue/KT-25655) Safe or non-null calls required on x following check(x != null) > - [`KT-25972`](https://youtrack.jetbrains.com/issue/KT-25972) Support reading binary metadata of the next major release > > #### Performance Improvements > > - [`KT-24657`](https://youtrack.jetbrains.com/issue/KT-24657) Compiler performance issues with big files > - [`KT-26243`](https://youtrack.jetbrains.com/issue/KT-26243) Avoid redundant "specialized" method for suspend lambdas. > > #### Fixes > > - [`KT-19628`](https://youtrack.jetbrains.com/issue/KT-19628) Unresolved reference not reported on data class constructor `[**get**](https://github.com/get)` annotation > - [`KT-20830`](https://youtrack.jetbrains.com/issue/KT-20830) Nulls can propagate through "enhanced nullability" types on module boundaries > - [`KT-21240`](https://youtrack.jetbrains.com/issue/KT-21240) Remove suspendCoroutineOrReturn intrinsic from compiler > - [`KT-22379`](https://youtrack.jetbrains.com/issue/KT-22379) Condition of while-loop with break can produce unsound smartcast > - [`KT-23438`](https://youtrack.jetbrains.com/issue/KT-23438) Back-end (JVM) Internal error: Failed to generate function suspendCoroutineOrReturn > - [`KT-23819`](https://youtrack.jetbrains.com/issue/KT-23819) Inline classes: mapping of fully generic classes > - [`KT-23857`](https://youtrack.jetbrains.com/issue/KT-23857) Annotation with target TYPE is not applicable to TYPE_USE in Java sources > - [`KT-24717`](https://youtrack.jetbrains.com/issue/KT-24717) Allow number literals to be used as unsigned ones with unsigned expected typed > - [`KT-24860`](https://youtrack.jetbrains.com/issue/KT-24860) Forbid usage function expression as suspend function expression > - [`KT-24872`](https://youtrack.jetbrains.com/issue/KT-24872) Do not generate user-defined methods inside box class of inline class > - [`KT-24873`](https://youtrack.jetbrains.com/issue/KT-24873) Generate equals/hashCode/toString methods for inline classes same as for data classes > - [`KT-25246`](https://youtrack.jetbrains.com/issue/KT-25246) Incorrect bytecode generated for secondary constructor in inline class + primitive array > - [`KT-25278`](https://youtrack.jetbrains.com/issue/KT-25278) No smart cast for "returns() implies" contract when default argument is omitted > - [`KT-25287`](https://youtrack.jetbrains.com/issue/KT-25287) Getter-targeted annotations on annotation constructor parameters are lost > - [`KT-25293`](https://youtrack.jetbrains.com/issue/KT-25293) “Couldn't transform method node” error on compiling inline class with hashCode() method call when underlying value type is basic (number, char, boolean) > - [`KT-25299`](https://youtrack.jetbrains.com/issue/KT-25299) NoSuchMethodError Foo$Erased.hashCode(Ljava/lang/Object;) for hashCode(), toString() and equals() methods in inline classes > - [`KT-25328`](https://youtrack.jetbrains.com/issue/KT-25328) “Couldn't transform method node” error on compiling inline class which is wrapping Unit type > - [`KT-25330`](https://youtrack.jetbrains.com/issue/KT-25330) CCE “[Ljava.lang.Integer; cannot be cast to Foo” for inline class which is wrapping Array > - [`KT-25521`](https://youtrack.jetbrains.com/issue/KT-25521) Coroutines state machine in Kotlin 1.3 should not have getLabel/setLabel > - [`KT-25558`](https://youtrack.jetbrains.com/issue/KT-25558) Stabilize field naming and mangling for suspending lambda classes > - [`KT-25580`](https://youtrack.jetbrains.com/issue/KT-25580) No warning about experimental API when unsigned types are inferred > - [`KT-25599`](https://youtrack.jetbrains.com/issue/KT-25599) “Exception during code generation” on compiling code with public constructor of unsigned numbers array > - [`KT-25614`](https://youtrack.jetbrains.com/issue/KT-25614) Support secondary constructors for inline classes > - [`KT-25683`](https://youtrack.jetbrains.com/issue/KT-25683) Compiler support for calling experimental suspend functions and function with experimental suspend function type as parameter > ... (truncated)
Commits - See full diff in [compare view](https://github.com/JetBrains/kotlin/commits)

title: Bump retrofitVersion from 2.3.0 to 2.4.0
label: [Label(name="dependencies")]
body:
Bumps `retrofitVersion` from 2.3.0 to 2.4.0. Updates `retrofit` from 2.3.0 to 2.4.0
Changelog *Sourced from [retrofit's changelog](https://github.com/square/retrofit/blob/master/CHANGELOG.md).* > Version 2.4.0 *(2018-03-14)* > ---------------------------- > > * New: `Retrofit.Builder` exposes mutable lists of the added converter and call adapter factories. > * New: Call adapter added for Scala's `Future`. > * New: Converter for JAXB replaces the now-deprecated converter for Simple XML Framework. > * New: Add Java 9 automatic module names for each artifact corresponding to their root package. > * Fix: Do not swallow `Error`s from callbacks (usually `OutOfMemoryError`). > * Fix: Moshi and Gson converters now assert that the full response was consumed. This prevents > hiding bugs in faulty adapters which might not have consumed the full JSON input which would > then cause failures on the next request over that connection. > * Fix: Do not conflate OkHttp `Call` cancelation with RxJava unsubscription/disposal. Prior to > this change, canceling of a `Call` would prevent a cancelation exception from propagating down > the Rx stream.
Commits - [`7158698`](https://github.com/square/retrofit/commit/7158698314daa138e993fac6a590ed19d78a8599) [maven-release-plugin] prepare release parent-2.4.0 - [`8e0720d`](https://github.com/square/retrofit/commit/8e0720d59bf75a025420d5019b91ca5e4c64b696) Rollback release plugin. - [`5ceb3d4`](https://github.com/square/retrofit/commit/5ceb3d4e4973bf681992545be9725b5d5de7ba73) Fix date. - [`c51a989`](https://github.com/square/retrofit/commit/c51a9896428576dbd2e8172defd25fa9f9c978dd) Prepare version 2.4.0. - [`31149ed`](https://github.com/square/retrofit/commit/31149ed9e5acacb03eb1c12d833a904cfc49958f) Merge pull request [#2688](https://github-redirect.dependabot.com/square/retrofit/issues/2688) from woprandi/woprandi-compile-to-implementation - [`5528728`](https://github.com/square/retrofit/commit/5528728bd9fd9d369aae70aa26a1e7921c5ad856) Replace 'compile' with 'implementation - [`2098b6d`](https://github.com/square/retrofit/commit/2098b6d4df921afabea298b216ea555a95485046) Replace 'compile' with 'implementation'. - [`0b56d38`](https://github.com/square/retrofit/commit/0b56d38c45c5e07cb99f883b0b93343bb3fba9bd) Small tweaks while doing other work. ([#2685](https://github-redirect.dependabot.com/square/retrofit/issues/2685)) - [`98ddee4`](https://github.com/square/retrofit/commit/98ddee499c2758ad45a83f34035fd74260c44c48) Merge pull request [#2673](https://github-redirect.dependabot.com/square/retrofit/issues/2673) from square/jwilson.0225.https_links - [`c793de3`](https://github.com/square/retrofit/commit/c793de34b30cdd592dfa735bc0537400a7221164) Use HTTPS links in documentation where possible. - Additional commits viewable in [compare view](https://github.com/square/retrofit/compare/parent-2.3.0...parent-2.4.0)

Updates `converter-gson` from 2.3.0 to 2.4.0 Updates `adapter-rxjava2` from 2.3.0 to 2.4.0 Dependabot will resolve any conflicts with this PR as long as you don't alter it yourself. You can also trigger a rebase manually by commenting `@dependabot rebase`. ---

You can trigger Dependabot actions by commenting on this PR: - `@dependabot rebase` will rebase this PR - `@dependabot merge` will merge this PR after your CI passes on it - `@dependabot cancel merge` will cancel a previously requested merge - `@dependabot reopen` will reopen this PR if it is closed - `@dependabot ignore this [patch|minor|major] version` will close this PR and stop Dependabot creating any more for this minor/major version (unless you reopen the PR or upgrade to it yourself) - `@dependabot ignore this dependency` will close this PR and stop Dependabot creating any more for this dependency (unless you reopen the PR or upgrade to it yourself) - `@dependabot use these labels` will set the current labels as the default for future PRs for this repo and language - `@dependabot use these reviewers` will set the current reviewers as the default for future PRs for this repo and language - `@dependabot use these assignees` will set the current assignees as the default for future PRs for this repo and language - `@dependabot use this milestone` will set the current milestone as the default for future PRs for this repo and language - `@dependabot badge me` will comment on this PR with code to add a "Dependabot enabled" badge to your readme Additionally, you can set the following in your Dependabot [dashboard](https://app.dependabot.com): - Update frequency (including time of day and day of week) - Automerge options (never/patch/minor, and dev/runtime dependencies) - Pull request limits (per update run and/or open at any time) - Out-of-range updates (receive only lockfile updates, if desired) - Security updates (receive only security updates, if desired) Finally, you can contact us by mentioning @dependabot.

title: Enable Gradle daemon
body: This commit enables the Gradle daemon for faster build times, as Gradle no longer generally recommends to disable the daemon for CI builds.

title: Refactor display of cafeteria menus in card and fragment
label: [Label(name="Improvement")]
body: We currently display cafeteria menus in the card view and in the fragment by manually sticking views together in a `LinearLayout`. To simplify our code, we should switch to another component (potentially a `RecyclerView`?).

title: Completely switch to verification based on device ID
body: This commits removes the ChatMemberVerification and only uses the device ID as provided by the AuthenticationManager.

title: Bump stripe-android from 6.1.2 to 8.0.0
label: [Label(name="dependencies")]
body:
Bumps [stripe-android](https://github.com/stripe/stripe-android) from 6.1.2 to 8.0.0.
Release notes *Sourced from [stripe-android's releases](https://github.com/stripe/stripe-android/releases).* > ## v8.0.0 > **BREAKING** Renamed PaymentIntentParams methods for readability [#609](https://github-redirect.dependabot.com/stripe/stripe-android/pull/609) > > ## v7.2.0 > Add beta support for PaymentIntents for usage with card sources > Add sample integration with PaymentIntents > Fix crash in MaskedCardAdapter > BREAKING Add preferredLanguage parameter to SourceParams.createBancontactParams [#589](https://github-redirect.dependabot.com/stripe/stripe-android/issues/589)
Changelog *Sourced from [stripe-android's changelog](https://github.com/stripe/stripe-android/blob/master/CHANGELOG.md).* > ### 8.0.0 2018-7-13 > * **BREAKING** Renamed PaymentIntentParams methods for readibility [#609](https://github-redirect.dependabot.com/stripe/stripe-android/pull/609) > > ### 7.2.0 2018-07-12 > * Add beta support for PaymentIntents for usage with card sources [] > * Add sample integration with PaymentIntents > * Fix crash in MaskedCardAdapter > * **BREAKING** Add `preferredLanguage` parameter to `SourceParams.createBancontactParams` [#589](https://github-redirect.dependabot.com/stripe/stripe-android/pull/589) > > ### 7.1.0 2018-06-11 > * Add EPS and Multibanco support to `SourceParams` [#583](https://github-redirect.dependabot.com/stripe/stripe-android/pull/583) > * Add `RequiredBillingAddressFields.NAME` option to enumeration [#586](https://github-redirect.dependabot.com/stripe/stripe-android/pull/586) > * **BREAKING** Fix `[**Nullable**](https://github.com/Nullable)` and `[**NonNull**](https://github.com/NonNull)` annotations for `createP24Params` function [#583](https://github-redirect.dependabot.com/stripe/stripe-android/pull/583/commits/d95d5969bbf4c01b61624ccb9626790c124f0647) > > ### 7.0.1 2018-05-25 > * Make iDEAL params match API - `name` is optional and optional ideal `bank` and `statement_descriptor` can be set independently > > ### 7.0.0 2018-04-25 > * Remove Bitcoin source support. See MIGRATING.md. [#559](https://github-redirect.dependabot.com/stripe/stripe-android/pull/559) > * Add create Masterpass source support [#549](https://github-redirect.dependabot.com/stripe/stripe-android/pull/549) > * Add support for 3 digit American Express CVC [#548](https://github-redirect.dependabot.com/stripe/stripe-android/pull/548) > * Fix crash when JCB icon is shown [#547](https://github-redirect.dependabot.com/stripe/stripe-android/pull/547)

title: Fix tests
label: [Label(name="Work in progress")]
body: This pull request makes tests work again (to some extent, for now).

title: Update user interface to lighter design
label: [Label(name="Improvement")]
body:
This pull request updates the entire app to a more consistent and lighter design. It includes: 
- More use of whitespace
- Usage of MaterialComponents from Support Library 28, including the new text fields and buttons
- Updated iconography (outlined instead of filled icons)
- An updated behavior of the navigation drawer, more in line with other applications

Open issues: 
- `UserPreferencesActivity` uses the wrong theme for some reason. Will investigate. 
- The text looks a little off, as the new buttons use a different font than the text views. Will unify that before the release.

---

Screenshots: 
![screenshot_20180909-091128](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/11819826/45262119-ac6b7500-b410-11e8-8fdc-8977f4670315.png)

![screenshot_20180909-091136](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/11819826/45262120-ac6b7500-b410-11e8-8524-2da09f5d4f04.png)

![screenshot_20180909-091146](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/11819826/45262121-ac6b7500-b410-11e8-9589-db31614d31a2.png)

title: Unify DeviceVerification & ChatVerification
label: [Label(name="High Priority :fire_engine:"), Label(name="Improvement")]
body:
https://github.com/TCA-Team/TumCampusApp/pull/908/commits/599f34174c3ebd78a30bb0c77a843b1c502755e1 

This commit introduced a breaking model change and is now incompatible with the current backend APIs, as the fields are currently named different. The intention behind it is right though and we should refactor out this ambiguity and not have different verification paths.

So we should make sure, that only `TUMCabeVerification` is used any more (already done, by merging the two other models) and that the `id` field is named `device` and only the ever the deviceId is sent to the backend. Please refactor any classes that still set this to the memberId and rename the field to indicate the correct id. 

We can then deduct the memberId correctly on the server side from the deviceId, as those should be linked correctly, once the wizard was completed. For those cases where the wizard did not link the user with the tumcabe member, we can offer a "open up the wizard again" card, to fix that setup. 

@thellmund please collect a list of API calls, that use this verification, so that I can adapt the server side implementation accordingly. This is high priority, as the current master branch is not usable in the current state.

title: Unify cafeteria and favorite dish notifications
label: [Label(name="Improvement")]
body: Now, the user can change the notification time of the “normal” cafeteria notifications. There are no longer separate notifications for favorite dishes. Instead, if a favorite dish is served on a particular date, the cafeteria notification will highlight it in the notification text.
