body:
Bumps `kotlin_version` from 1.2.60 to 1.2.61. Updates `kotlin-gradle-plugin` from 1.2.60 to 1.2.61
Release notes *Sourced from [kotlin-gradle-plugin's releases](https://github.com/JetBrains/kotlin/releases).* > ## Kotlin 1.2.60 RC2 > ### Compiler > > - [`KT-22517`](https://youtrack.jetbrains.com/issue/KT-22517) Deprecate smartcasts for local delegated properties > - [`KT-24911`](https://youtrack.jetbrains.com/issue/KT-24911) Kotlin 1.2.50: UI for [**RecentlyNonNull**](https://github.com/RecentlyNonNull) looks strange in the editor > - [`KT-25333`](https://youtrack.jetbrains.com/issue/KT-25333) Restrict visibility of Java static members from supertypes of companion object > > ### IDE > > - [`KT-15300`](https://youtrack.jetbrains.com/issue/KT-15300) "INFO - project.TargetPlatformDetector - Using default platform" flood in log > - [`KT-24979`](https://youtrack.jetbrains.com/issue/KT-24979) IndexNotReadyException in KtLightClassForSourceDeclaration#isInheritor > - [`KT-25242`](https://youtrack.jetbrains.com/issue/KT-25242) 'Resolved to error element' highlighting is confusingly similar to an active live template > - [`KT-25414`](https://youtrack.jetbrains.com/issue/KT-25414) Support checking eap-1.3 channel for updates > - [`KT-25524`](https://youtrack.jetbrains.com/issue/KT-25524) UAST: proper resolve for function variable call > > ### IDE. Android > > - [`KT-17946`](https://youtrack.jetbrains.com/issue/KT-17946) Android Studio: remove Gradle configurator on configuring Kotlin > > ### IDE. Refactorings > > - [`KT-23983`](https://youtrack.jetbrains.com/issue/KT-23983) Extract function: Reified type parameters are not extracted properly > > ### IDE. Script > > - [`KT-25373`](https://youtrack.jetbrains.com/issue/KT-25373) Deadlock in idea plugin > > ### Language design > > - [`KT-13762`](https://youtrack.jetbrains.com/issue/KT-13762) Prohibit annotations with target 'EXPRESSION' and retention 'BINARY' or 'RUNTIME' > > ### Libraries > > - [`KT-25351`](https://youtrack.jetbrains.com/issue/KT-25351) `TestNGAsserter` needs to swap expected/actual > > ### Tools. Android Extensions > > - [`KT-22576`](https://youtrack.jetbrains.com/issue/KT-22576) Parcelable: Allow Parcelize to work with object and enum types > - [`KT-24459`](https://youtrack.jetbrains.com/issue/KT-24459) [**IgnoredOnParcel**](https://github.com/IgnoredOnParcel) annotation doesn't work for [**Parcelize**](https://github.com/Parcelize) > - [`KT-24720`](https://youtrack.jetbrains.com/issue/KT-24720) Parcelable: java.lang.LinkageError > > ### Tools. Compiler Plugins > > - [`KT-23808`](https://youtrack.jetbrains.com/issue/KT-23808) Array in [**Parcelize**](https://github.com/Parcelize) class generates an java.lang.VerifyError > > ### Tools. JPS > > - [`KT-22611`](https://youtrack.jetbrains.com/issue/KT-22611) Support compiling scripts in JPS > > ### Tools. kapt > ... (truncated)
Changelog *Sourced from [kotlin-gradle-plugin's changelog](https://github.com/JetBrains/kotlin/blob/master/ChangeLog.md).* > # CHANGELOG
Commits - See full diff in [compare view](https://github.com/JetBrains/kotlin/commits)

Updates `kotlin-stdlib-jdk7` from $kotlin_version to 1.2.61
Changelog *Sourced from [kotlin-stdlib-jdk7's changelog](https://github.com/JetBrains/kotlin/blob/master/ChangeLog.md).* > # CHANGELOG > > ## 1.2.60 > > ### Compiler > > - [`KT-13762`](https://youtrack.jetbrains.com/issue/KT-13762) Prohibit annotations with target 'EXPRESSION' and retention 'BINARY' or 'RUNTIME' > - [`KT-18882`](https://youtrack.jetbrains.com/issue/KT-18882) Allow code to have platform specific annotations when compiled for different platforms > - [`KT-20356`](https://youtrack.jetbrains.com/issue/KT-20356) Internal compiler error - This method shouldn't be invoked for INVISIBLE_FAKE visibility > - [`KT-22517`](https://youtrack.jetbrains.com/issue/KT-22517) Deprecate smartcasts for local delegated properties > - [`KT-23153`](https://youtrack.jetbrains.com/issue/KT-23153) Compiler allows to set non constant value as annotation parameter > - [`KT-23413`](https://youtrack.jetbrains.com/issue/KT-23413) IndexOutOfBoundsException on local delegated properties from `provideDelegate` if there's at least one non-local delegated property > - [`KT-23742`](https://youtrack.jetbrains.com/issue/KT-23742) Optimise inline class redundant boxing on return from inlined lambda > - [`KT-24513`](https://youtrack.jetbrains.com/issue/KT-24513) High memory usage in Kotlin and 2018.1 > - [`KT-24617`](https://youtrack.jetbrains.com/issue/KT-24617) Optional expected annotation is unresolved in a dependent platform module > - [`KT-24679`](https://youtrack.jetbrains.com/issue/KT-24679) KotlinUCallExpression doesn't resolve callee if it is an inline method > - [`KT-24808`](https://youtrack.jetbrains.com/issue/KT-24808) NI: nested `withContext` call is reported with `Suspension functions can be called only within coroutine body` error > - [`KT-24825`](https://youtrack.jetbrains.com/issue/KT-24825) NoClassDefFoundError on SAM adapter in a nested call in inlined lambda since 1.2.40 > - [`KT-24859`](https://youtrack.jetbrains.com/issue/KT-24859) Disallow calls of functions annotated with receiver annotated with [**RestrictsSuspension**](https://github.com/RestrictsSuspension) in foreign suspension context > - [`KT-24911`](https://youtrack.jetbrains.com/issue/KT-24911) Kotlin 1.2.50: UI for [**RecentlyNonNull**](https://github.com/RecentlyNonNull) looks strange in the editor > - [`KT-25333`](https://youtrack.jetbrains.com/issue/KT-25333) Restrict visibility of Java static members from supertypes of companion object > > ### IDE > > #### Performance Improvements > > - [`KT-20924`](https://youtrack.jetbrains.com/issue/KT-20924) Slow KtLightAbstractAnnotation.getClsDelegate() lightAnnotations.kt > - [`KT-23844`](https://youtrack.jetbrains.com/issue/KT-23844) Kotlin property accessor searcher consumes CPU when invoked on a scope consisting only of Java files > > #### Fixes > > - [`KT-4311`](https://youtrack.jetbrains.com/issue/KT-4311) "Override members" works wrong when function is extension > - [`KT-13948`](https://youtrack.jetbrains.com/issue/KT-13948) IDE plugins: improve description > - [`KT-15300`](https://youtrack.jetbrains.com/issue/KT-15300) "INFO - project.TargetPlatformDetector - Using default platform" flood in log > - [`KT-17350`](https://youtrack.jetbrains.com/issue/KT-17350) Implement members from interface fails when one of the generic types is unresolved > - [`KT-17668`](https://youtrack.jetbrains.com/issue/KT-17668) Edit Configuration dialog doesn't have a button for choosing the "Main class" field > - [`KT-19102`](https://youtrack.jetbrains.com/issue/KT-19102) Wrong equals() and hashCode() code generated for arrays of arrays > - [`KT-20056`](https://youtrack.jetbrains.com/issue/KT-20056) TCE on creating object of an anonymous class in Kotlin script > - [`KT-21863`](https://youtrack.jetbrains.com/issue/KT-21863) Imported typealias to object declared as "Unused import directive" when only referring to methods > - [`KT-23272`](https://youtrack.jetbrains.com/issue/KT-23272) Git commit not working > - [`KT-23407`](https://youtrack.jetbrains.com/issue/KT-23407) Pasting callable reference from different package suggests imports, but inserts incompilable FQN > - [`KT-23456`](https://youtrack.jetbrains.com/issue/KT-23456) UAST: Enum constant constructor call arguments missing from Kotlin enums > - [`KT-23942`](https://youtrack.jetbrains.com/issue/KT-23942) Fix building light-classes for MPP project containing multi-file facades > - [`KT-24072`](https://youtrack.jetbrains.com/issue/KT-24072) Kotlin SDK appears as many times as there are modules in the project > - [`KT-24412`](https://youtrack.jetbrains.com/issue/KT-24412) Kotlin create project wizard: Kotlin/JS no SDK > - [`KT-24933`](https://youtrack.jetbrains.com/issue/KT-24933) please remove usages of com.intellij.psi.search.searches.DirectClassInheritorsSearch#search(com.intellij.psi.PsiClass, com.intellij.psi.search.SearchScope, boolean, boolean) deprecated long ago > - [`KT-24943`](https://youtrack.jetbrains.com/issue/KT-24943) Project leak via LibraryEffectiveKindProviderImpl > - [`KT-24979`](https://youtrack.jetbrains.com/issue/KT-24979) IndexNotReadyException in KtLightClassForSourceDeclaration#isInheritor > - [`KT-24958`](https://youtrack.jetbrains.com/issue/KT-24958) Escaping goes insane when editing interpolated string in injected fragment editor > - [`KT-25024`](https://youtrack.jetbrains.com/issue/KT-25024) Wrong resolve scope while resolving java.lang.String PsiClassReferenceType > ... (truncated)
Commits - See full diff in [compare view](https://github.com/JetBrains/kotlin/commits)

Updates `kotlin-test-junit` from $kotlin_version to 1.2.61
Changelog *Sourced from [kotlin-test-junit's changelog](https://github.com/JetBrains/kotlin/blob/master/ChangeLog.md).* > # CHANGELOG > > ## 1.2.60 > > ### Compiler > > - [`KT-13762`](https://youtrack.jetbrains.com/issue/KT-13762) Prohibit annotations with target 'EXPRESSION' and retention 'BINARY' or 'RUNTIME' > - [`KT-24679`](https://youtrack.jetbrains.com/issue/KT-24679) KotlinUCallExpression doesn't resolve callee if it is an inline method > - [`KT-24808`](https://youtrack.jetbrains.com/issue/KT-24808) NI: nested `withContext` call is reported with `Suspension functions can be called only within coroutine body` error > - [`KT-24825`](https://youtrack.jetbrains.com/issue/KT-24825) NoClassDefFoundError on SAM adapter in a nested call in inlined lambda since 1.2.40 > - [`KT-24859`](https://youtrack.jetbrains.com/issue/KT-24859) Disallow calls of functions annotated with receiver annotated with [**RestrictsSuspension**](https://github.com/RestrictsSuspension) in foreign suspension context > - [`KT-20924`](https://youtrack.jetbrains.com/issue/KT-20924) Slow KtLightAbstractAnnotation.getClsDelegate() lightAnnotations.kt > - [`KT-23844`](https://youtrack.jetbrains.com/issue/KT-23844) Kotlin property accessor searcher consumes CPU when invoked on a scope consisting only of Java files > > #### Fixes > > - [`KT-4311`](https://youtrack.jetbrains.com/issue/KT-4311) "Override members" works wrong when function is extension > - [`KT-13948`](https://youtrack.jetbrains.com/issue/KT-13948) IDE plugins: improve description > - title: Bump rxandroid from 2.0.2 to 2.1.0
label: [Label(name="dependencies")]
body:
Bumps [rxandroid](https://github.com/ReactiveX/RxAndroid) from 2.0.2 to 2.1.0.
Release notes *Sourced from [rxandroid's releases](https://github.com/ReactiveX/RxAndroid/releases).* > ## 2.1.0 > **API Enhancements** > > * [Pull 416](https://github-redirect.dependabot.com/ReactiveX/RxAndroid/pull/416) - Add an option to post async messages > > > Download: > > ``` groovy > implementation 'io.reactivex.rxjava2:rxandroid:2.1.0' > ```
Changelog *Sourced from [rxandroid's changelog](https://github.com/ReactiveX/RxAndroid/blob/2.x/CHANGES.md).* > ### Version 2.1.0 - August 16, 2018 ### > > **API Enhancements** > > * [Pull 416](https://github-redirect.dependabot.com/ReactiveX/RxAndroid/pull/416) - Add an option to post async messages
Commits - [`0efa444`](https://github.com/ReactiveX/RxAndroid/commit/0efa44442c2bcfe4e37290ef0d743046fa2fc985) Prepare version 2.1.0 - [`a78a85e`](https://github.com/ReactiveX/RxAndroid/commit/a78a85ec6e2675db8a41f325df9a073a44312903) Merge pull request [#437](https://github-redirect.dependabot.com/ReactiveX/RxAndroid/issues/437) from shaishavgandhi05/sg/update-dependencies - [`908e6ed`](https://github.com/ReactiveX/RxAndroid/commit/908e6ed745ce24e8328774bb113e497ac86be169) Update gradle version - [`9afb1dc`](https://github.com/ReactiveX/RxAndroid/commit/9afb1dcfc9d9efce7367e219c9f80ff97cbdf029) Upgrade dependencies - [`9f81070`](https://github.com/ReactiveX/RxAndroid/commit/9f810700753eefcc8c55f0b52fb8ec0c188e6a9d) Update dependencies ([#435](https://github-redirect.dependabot.com/ReactiveX/RxAndroid/issues/435)) - [`191a758`](https://github.com/ReactiveX/RxAndroid/commit/191a758fcce4e4d16ad0438ad4dac3fd01b4362f) Add an option to post async messages - [`e09c2d7`](https://github.com/ReactiveX/RxAndroid/commit/e09c2d7e6236abfc14195823e62aa0276653b38d) Merge pull request [#425](https://github-redirect.dependabot.com/ReactiveX/RxAndroid/issues/425) from ReactiveX/race - [`c4ef6b0`](https://github.com/ReactiveX/RxAndroid/commit/c4ef6b0acc6d8fedbf90a06bcdc7112d59442bc3) Remove handler callbacks before setting disposed. - [`5cb2391`](https://github.com/ReactiveX/RxAndroid/commit/5cb239130dceab95797b7313b19f2d8e95407d8f) Prepare next development version. - See full diff in [compare view](https://github.com/ReactiveX/RxAndroid/compare/2.0.2...2.1.0)

[![Dependabot compatibility score](https://api.dependabot.com/badges/compatibility_score?dependency-name=io.reactivex.rxjava2:rxandroid&package-manager=gradle&previous-version=2.0.2&new-version=2.1.0)](https://dependabot.com/compatibility-score.html?dependency-name=io.reactivex.rxjava2:rxandroid&package-manager=gradle&previous-version=2.0.2&new-version=2.1.0) Dependabot will resolve any conflicts with this PR as long as you don't alter it yourself. title: Bump assertj-core from 3.10.0 to 3.11.0 in /app
label: [Label(name="dependencies")]
body:
Bumps [assertj-core](https://github.com/joel-costigliola/assertj-core) from 3.10.0 to 3.11.0.
Commits - [`c3d4ac6`](https://github.com/joel-costigliola/assertj-core/commit/c3d4ac65dfb9139e89d5e8b5eb1b56a4592a73b3) [maven-release-plugin] prepare release assertj-core-3.11.0 - [`bbc89eb`](https://github.com/joel-costigliola/assertj-core/commit/bbc89eb506f9ded7ce488e11275bdff75c7b932e) Use System.identityHashCode() to disambiguate objects with same hash code (fi... - [`324ada5`](https://github.com/joel-costigliola/assertj-core/commit/324ada52d87c2268fcadb846a806fbfadf98a1de) Fix javadoc warnings - [`ce2dcef`](https://github.com/joel-costigliola/assertj-core/commit/ce2dcef5ba64bb878aaa05339dc306767bb3d807) fail(): return a value - [`1e40b38`](https://github.com/joel-costigliola/assertj-core/commit/1e40b3814a32bc93910bbe03aa8057617e6a770b) hasMessage now fails with an AssertionFailedError if available and will repor... - [`0547bfc`](https://github.com/joel-costigliola/assertj-core/commit/0547bfce2f39811b1c89cf31e2f52b0445937a09) containsAnyElementsOf should use bounded wildcard - [`07174b2`](https://github.com/joel-costigliola/assertj-core/commit/07174b2011d58e4340b4b24739ea4eea2fe55de8) Change ShouldBeEqual to try to build an AssertionFailedError before a Compari... - [`268b20b`](https://github.com/joel-costigliola/assertj-core/commit/268b20b462f877a28815059e4c7f57fa8b61a1ce) Added org.junit, org.opentest4j and org.testng as optional package imports to... - [`596c5c3`](https://github.com/joel-costigliola/assertj-core/commit/596c5c3bb07b540a2d3bc2d70f7a9e52005cbf44) Javadoc improvements - [`8b85ed1`](https://github.com/joel-costigliola/assertj-core/commit/8b85ed137b911c2f9b919741fc303d64d64d0219) Fix parameter names in isStrictlyBetween that used the word inclusive instead... - Additional commits viewable in [compare view](https://github.com/joel-costigliola/assertj-core/compare/assertj-core-3.10.0...assertj-core-3.11.0)

title: Bump assertj-core from 3.10.0 to 3.11.0
label: [Label(name="dependencies")]
body:
Bumps [assertj-core](https://github.com/joel-costigliola/assertj-core) from 3.10.0 to 3.11.0.

title: Fix NetworkOnMainThreadException in CacheManager

title: Calendar: Network on MainThread

Current master crashes with this exception

```

title: Bump guava from 25.1-android to 26.0-android in /app
label: [Label(name="dependencies")]
body:
Bumps [guava](https://github.com/google/guava) from 25.1-android to 26.0-android.
Release notes *Sourced from [guava's releases](https://github.com/google/guava/releases).* > ## 26.0 > ### Maven > > ```xml > > com.google.guava > guava > 26.0-jre > > 26.0-android > > ``` > > ### Javadoc > > - [26.0-jre](http://google.github.io/guava/releases/26.0-jre/api/docs/) > - [26.0-android](http://google.github.io/guava/releases/26.0-android/api/docs/) > > ### JDiff > > - [26.0-jre vs. 25.1-jre](http://google.github.io/guava/releases/26.0-jre/api/diffs/) > - [26.0-android vs. 25.1-android](http://google.github.io/guava/releases/26.0-android/api/diffs/) > - [26.0-android vs. 26.0-jre](http://google.github.io/guava/releases/26.0-android/api/androiddiffs/) > > ### Changelog > > - `base`: Removed deprecated `public static` fields from `CharMatcher`. Use the equivalent `public static` methods instead. (f1249c4f0) > - `base`: Fixed the `ServiceConfigurationError` that some users encountered when using Guava as a JPMS module. (8287cdfa3) > - `cache`: Fixed a bug where `Cache.asMap.compute*` methods could cause nonsensical weights to be stored, breaking cache eviction. (15764d7f3) > - `concurrent`: Removed deprecated `Futures` methods that implicitly use `directExecutor()`. (87d87f5ca) > - `concurrent`: Added `ExecutionSequencer`, a new utility to run a series of asynchronous operations serially. (8d1fbc96e) > - `concurrent`: Removed special-casing `UndeclaredThrowableException` in `Futures.transform()`. (9466b62f5) > - `net`: Changed `HostAndPort.equals()` and `hashCode()` to stop depending on whether brackets were included. Now they depend only on host and port. (34c161627) > - `net`: Added `HttpHeaders` constant for Sec-Metadata header. (986a3a3ef) > - `net`: Added `MediaType` for "application/hal+json". (fea88fe49)
Commits - See full diff in [compare view](https://github.com/google/guava/commits)

[![Dependabot compatibility score](https://api.dependabot.com/badges/compatibility_score?dependency-name=com.google.guava:guava&package-manager=gradle&previous-version=25.1-android&new-version=26.0-android)](https://dependabot.com/compatibility-score.html?dependency-name=com.google.guava:guava&package-manager=gradle&previous-version=25.1-android&new-version=26.0-android) Dependabot will resolve any conflicts with this PR as long as you don't alter it yourself. title: Bump kotlin_version from 1.2.51 to 1.2.60
label: [Label(name="dependencies")]
body:
Bumps `kotlin_version` from 1.2.51 to 1.2.60. Updates `kotlin-gradle-plugin` from 1.2.51 to 1.2.60 Updates `kotlin-stdlib-jdk7` from $kotlin_version to 1.2.60
Release notes *Sourced from [kotlin-stdlib-jdk7's releases](https://github.com/JetBrains/kotlin/releases).* > ## Kotlin 1.2.60 > ## 1.2.60 > > ### Compiler > > - [`KT-13762`](https://youtrack.jetbrains.com/issue/KT-13762) Prohibit annotations with target 'EXPRESSION' and retention 'BINARY' or 'RUNTIME' > - [`KT-18882`](https://youtrack.jetbrains.com/issue/KT-18882) Allow code to have platform specific annotations when compiled for different platforms > - [`KT-20356`](https://youtrack.jetbrains.com/issue/KT-20356) Internal compiler error - This method shouldn't be invoked for INVISIBLE_FAKE visibility > - [`KT-22517`](https://youtrack.jetbrains.com/issue/KT-22517) Deprecate smartcasts for local delegated properties > - [`KT-23153`](https://youtrack.jetbrains.com/issue/KT-23153) Compiler allows to set non constant value as annotation parameter > - [`KT-23413`](https://youtrack.jetbrains.com/issue/KT-23413) IndexOutOfBoundsException on local delegated properties from `provideDelegate` if there's at least one non-local delegated property > - [`KT-23742`](https://youtrack.jetbrains.com/issue/KT-23742) Optimise inline class redundant boxing on return from inlined lambda > - [`KT-24513`](https://youtrack.jetbrains.com/issue/KT-24513) High memory usage in Kotlin and 2018.1 > - [`KT-24617`](https://youtrack.jetbrains.com/issue/KT-24617) Optional expected annotation is unresolved in a dependent platform module > - [`KT-24679`](https://youtrack.jetbrains.com/issue/KT-24679) KotlinUCallExpression doesn't resolve callee if it is an inline method > - [`KT-24808`](https://youtrack.jetbrains.com/issue/KT-24808) NI: nested `withContext` call is reported with `Suspension functions can be called only within coroutine body` error > - [`KT-24825`](https://youtrack.jetbrains.com/issue/KT-24825) NoClassDefFoundError on SAM adapter in a nested call in inlined lambda since 1.2.40 > - [`KT-24859`](https://youtrack.jetbrains.com/issue/KT-24859) Disallow calls of functions annotated with receiver annotated with [**RestrictsSuspension**](https://github.com/RestrictsSuspension) in foreign suspension context > - [`KT-24911`](https://youtrack.jetbrains.com/issue/KT-24911) Kotlin 1.2.50: UI for [**RecentlyNonNull**](https://github.com/RecentlyNonNull) looks strange in the editor > - [`KT-25333`](https://youtrack.jetbrains.com/issue/KT-25333) Restrict visibility of Java static members from supertypes of companion object > > ### IDE > > #### Performance Improvements > > - [`KT-20924`](https://youtrack.jetbrains.com/issue/KT-20924) Slow KtLightAbstractAnnotation.getClsDelegate() lightAnnotations.kt > - [`KT-23844`](https://youtrack.jetbrains.com/issue/KT-23844) Kotlin property accessor searcher consumes CPU when invoked on a scope consisting only of Java files > > #### Fixes > > - [`KT-4311`](https://youtrack.jetbrains.com/issue/KT-4311) "Override members" works wrong when function is extension > - [`KT-13948`](https://youtrack.jetbrains.com/issue/KT-13948) IDE plugins: improve description > - [`KT-15300`](https://youtrack.jetbrains.com/issue/KT-15300) "INFO - project.TargetPlatformDetector - Using default platform" flood in log > - [`KT-17350`](https://youtrack.jetbrains.com/issue/KT-17350) Implement members from interface fails when one of the generic types is unresolved > - [`KT-17668`](https://youtrack.jetbrains.com/issue/KT-17668) Edit Configuration dialog doesn't have a button for choosing the "Main class" field > - [`KT-19102`](https://youtrack.jetbrains.com/issue/KT-19102) Wrong equals() and hashCode() code generated for arrays of arrays > - [`KT-20056`](https://youtrack.jetbrains.com/issue/KT-20056) TCE on creating object of an anonymous class in Kotlin script > - [`KT-21863`](https://youtrack.jetbrains.com/issue/KT-21863) Imported typealias to object declared as "Unused import directive" when only referring to methods > - [`KT-23272`](https://youtrack.jetbrains.com/issue/KT-23272) Git commit not working > - [`KT-23407`](https://youtrack.jetbrains.com/issue/KT-23407) Pasting callable reference from different package suggests imports, but inserts incompilable FQN > - [`KT-23456`](https://youtrack.jetbrains.com/issue/KT-23456) UAST: Enum constant constructor call arguments missing from Kotlin enums > - [`KT-23942`](https://youtrack.jetbrains.com/issue/KT-23942) Fix building light-classes for MPP project containing multi-file facades > - [`KT-24072`](https://youtrack.jetbrains.com/issue/KT-24072) Kotlin SDK appears as many times as there are modules in the project > - [`KT-24412`](https://youtrack.jetbrains.com/issue/KT-24412) Kotlin create project wizard: Kotlin/JS no SDK > - [`KT-24933`](https://youtrack.jetbrains.com/issue/KT-24933) please remove usages of com.intellij.psi.search.searches.DirectClassInheritorsSearch#search(com.intellij.psi.PsiClass, com.intellij.psi.search.SearchScope, boolean, boolean) deprecated long ago > - [`KT-24943`](https://youtrack.jetbrains.com/issue/KT-24943) Project leak via LibraryEffectiveKindProviderImpl > - [`KT-24979`](https://youtrack.jetbrains.com/issue/KT-24979) IndexNotReadyException in KtLightClassForSourceDeclaration#isInheritor > - [`KT-24958`](https://youtrack.jetbrains.com/issue/KT-24958) Escaping goes insane when editing interpolated string in injected fragment editor > - [`KT-25024`](https://youtrack.jetbrains.com/issue/KT-25024) Wrong resolve scope while resolving java.lang.String PsiClassReferenceType > - [`KT-25092`](https://youtrack.jetbrains.com/issue/KT-25092) SourcePsi should be physical leaf element but got OPERATION_REFERENCE > ... (truncated)
Changelog *Sourced from [kotlin-stdlib-jdk7's changelog](https://github.com/JetBrains/kotlin/blob/master/ChangeLog.md).* > # CHANGELOG > > ## 1.2.51 > > ### Backend. JVM > > - [`KT-23943`](https://youtrack.jetbrains.com/issue/KT-23943) Wrong autoboxing for non-null inline class inside elvis with `null` constant > - [`KT-24952`](https://youtrack.jetbrains.com/issue/KT-24952) EnumConstantNotPresentExceptionProxy from Java reflection on annotation class with target TYPE on JVM < 8 > - [`KT-24986`](https://youtrack.jetbrains.com/issue/KT-24986) Android project release build with ProGuard enabled crashes with IllegalAccessError: Final field cannot be written to by method > > ### Binary Metadata > > - [`KT-24944`](https://youtrack.jetbrains.com/issue/KT-24944) Exception from stubs: "Unknown type parameter with id = 1" (EA-120997) > > ### Reflection > > - [`KT-23962`](https://youtrack.jetbrains.com/issue/KT-23962) MalformedParameterizedTypeException when reflecting GeneratedMessageLite.ExtendableMessage > > ### Tools. Gradle > > - [`KT-24956`](https://youtrack.jetbrains.com/issue/KT-24956) Kotlin Gradle plugin's inspectClassesForKotlinIC task for the new 1.2.50 release takes incredibly long > - [`KT-23866`](https://youtrack.jetbrains.com/issue/KT-23866) Kapt plugin should pass arguments from compiler argument providers to annotation processors > - [`KT-24716`](https://youtrack.jetbrains.com/issue/KT-24716) 1.2.50 emits warning "Classpath entry points to a non-existent location:" > - [`KT-24832`](https://youtrack.jetbrains.com/issue/KT-24832) Inter-project IC does not work when "kotlin-android" project depends on "kotlin" project > - [`KT-24938`](https://youtrack.jetbrains.com/issue/KT-24938) Gradle parallel execution fails on multi-module Gradle Project > - [`KT-25027`](https://youtrack.jetbrains.com/issue/KT-25027) Kapt plugin: Kapt and KaptGenerateStubs tasks have some incorrect inputs > > ### Tools. Scripts > > - [`KT-24926`](https://youtrack.jetbrains.com/issue/KT-24926) NoSuchElementException in TemplateAnnotationVisitor when upgrading the Gradle Kotlin DSL to Kotlin 1.2.50 > > ## 1.2.50 > > ### Compiler > > - [`KT-23360`](https://youtrack.jetbrains.com/issue/KT-23360) Do not serialize annotations with retention SOURCE to metadata > - [`KT-24278`](https://youtrack.jetbrains.com/issue/KT-24278) Hard-code to kotlin compiler annotation for android library migration > - [`KT-24472`](https://youtrack.jetbrains.com/issue/KT-24472) Support argfiles in kotlinc with -Xargfile > - [`KT-24593`](https://youtrack.jetbrains.com/issue/KT-24593) Support -XXLanguage:{+|-}LanguageFeature compiler arguments to enable/disable specific features > - [`KT-24637`](https://youtrack.jetbrains.com/issue/KT-24637) Introduce "progressive" mode of compiler > > #### Backend. [`KT-18882`](https://youtrack.jetbrains.com/issue/KT-18882) Allow code to have platform specific annotations when compiled for different platforms > - [`KT-20356`](https://youtrack.jetbrains.com/issue/KT-20356) Internal compiler error - This method shouldn't be invoked for INVISIBLE_FAKE visibility > - [`KT-22517`](https://youtrack.jetbrains.com/issue/KT-22517) Deprecate smartcasts for local delegated properties > - [`KT-23153`](https://youtrack.jetbrains.com/issue/KT-23153) Compiler allows to set non constant value as annotation parameter > - [`KT-23413`](https://youtrack.jetbrains.com/issue/KT-23413) IndexOutOfBoundsException on local delegated properties from `provideDelegate` if there's at least one non-local delegated property > - [`KT-23742`](https://youtrack.jetbrains.com/issue/KT-23742) Optimise inline class redundant boxing on return from inlined lambda > - title: Bump guava from 25.1-android to 26.0-android
label: [Label(name="dependencies")]
body:
Bumps [guava](https://github.com/google/guava) from 25.1-android to 26.0-android.
Release notes *Sourced from [guava's releases](https://github.com/google/guava/releases).* > ## 26.0 > ### Maven > > ```xml > > com.google.guava > guava > 26.0-jre > > 26.0-android > > ``` > > ### Javadoc > > - [26.0-jre](http://google.github.io/guava/releases/26.0-jre/api/docs/) > - [26.0-android](http://google.github.io/guava/releases/26.0-android/api/docs/) > > ### JDiff > > - [26.0-jre vs. 25.1-jre](http://google.github.io/guava/releases/26.0-jre/api/diffs/) > - [26.0-android vs. 25.1-android](http://google.github.io/guava/releases/26.0-android/api/diffs/) > - [26.0-android vs. 26.0-jre](http://google.github.io/guava/releases/26.0-android/api/androiddiffs/) > > ### Changelog > > - `base`: Removed deprecated `public static` fields from `CharMatcher`. Use the equivalent `public static` methods instead. (f1249c4f0) > - `base`: Fixed the `ServiceConfigurationError` that some users encountered when using Guava as a JPMS module. (8287cdfa3) > - `cache`: Fixed a bug where `Cache.asMap.compute*` methods could cause nonsensical weights to be stored, breaking cache eviction. (15764d7f3) > - `concurrent`: Removed deprecated `Futures` methods that implicitly use `directExecutor()`. (87d87f5ca) > - `concurrent`: Added `ExecutionSequencer`, a new utility to run a series of asynchronous operations serially. (8d1fbc96e) > - `concurrent`: Removed special-casing `UndeclaredThrowableException` in `Futures.transform()`. (9466b62f5) > - `net`: Changed `HostAndPort.equals()` and `hashCode()` to stop depending on whether brackets were included. Now they depend only on host and port. (34c161627) > - `net`: Added `HttpHeaders` constant for Sec-Metadata header. (986a3a3ef) > - `net`: Added `MediaType` for "application/hal+json". (fea88fe49)
Commits - See full diff in [compare view](https://github.com/google/guava/commits)

title: Bump rxlifecycle from 2.2.1 to 2.2.2 in /app
label: [Label(name="dependencies")]
body:
Bumps [rxlifecycle](https://github.com/trello/RxLifecycle) from 2.2.1 to 2.2.2.
Release notes *Sourced from [rxlifecycle's releases](https://github.com/trello/RxLifecycle/releases).* > ## v2.2.2 > - [#275](https://github-redirect.dependabot.com/trello/RxLifecycle/pull/275): Updated dependencies > > Normally simply updating dependencies wouldn't justify a new release, except that there are some R8 issues with RxLifecycle (due to it being compiled with Android lifecycle 1.0.0 instead of 1.1.0).

title: do MVV calls with RXJava
body:
Follow-up from #1018

Just tested the code, while @kordianbruck just merged and closed the issue :tada: 
Turns out, @thellmund wasn't all wrong when mentioning nobody handled the `JsonParseExceptions`, because we were executing the calls manually only caught `IOExceptions`...
So instead we now do the calls with RxJava, which can properly handle all kinds of errors, so the app shouldn't crash anymore.

I also caught a `IndexOutOfBounds` in `MVVSymbolView`...

title: Proxy Cafeteria through tumcabe API
label: [Label(name="Suggestion :telescope:")]
body: In order to faster react to changes and in case we ever want to change the cafeteria structure, we want to proxy the requests from the clients through our own API similar to the study rooms.

title: Refactor cafeteria notification settings
label: [Label(name="Improvement")]
body:
I originally planned to fix the Application Not Responding issue in the
activity, but decided to completely refactor it in Kotlin. This
implementation no longer uses ListView and provides a cleaner API for
persisting notification times.

title: Move to Retrofit for Study Rooms
label: [Label(name="Improvement")]

title: Refactor grades activity
label: [Label(name="Improvement")]
body: We had crashes in GradesActivity due to nullability. I converted the class to Kotlin and improved the code.

title: Feature suggestions
label: [Label(name="Suggestion :telescope:")]
body:
- Integration des Tum Roomfinders
- Öffnen (zumindest per Link) der moodle-Kurse
- Informationen, wer die App entwickelt hat
- Cafeteria wird mir nicht angezeigt
- Sollte auch funktionieren, wenn nicht alle Berechtigungen bei den Login über TUMonline gegeben werden. Dann werden z.B. die Noten halt nicht angezeigt.

title: Fix NullPointerException when clicking an event
label: [Label(name="Bug :bug:")]
body:
When clicking an event in the week view, the corresponding `CalendarItem` is retrieved from the database. If the query returns null for whatever reason, the app crashes (happened very rarely). I’ve added a null check to prevent this.

Additionally, instead of using the event's start and end time to query for the `CalendarItem`, the proper event ID is now used.

title: Refactor parts of CafeteriaLocalRepository to prevent widget crash
label: [Label(name="Bug :bug:")]
body: A `blockingFirst()` on a `Flowable` produced a `NoSuchElementException` in `MensaRemoteViewFactory`. When further investigating this, I noticed a number of unnecessary `Flowable` usages. I refactored the questionable parts without `Flowable` and used `Flowable.fromCallable()` if a `Flowable` was actually needed.

title: Add Firebase-Core to prevent rare crash
label: [Label(name="Bug :bug:")]
body: We had a small number of crashes that apparently come from the fact that we don’t include Firebase Core in the app. I also get the corresponding warning during the build process. This commit aims to fix that.

title: Re-enable and fix calendar sync
label: [Label(name="Bug :bug:")]
body: In #940, I accidentally omitted the calendar sync. This commit re-enables it and also prevents a sync-related crash that occurred exclusively on Huawei devices. (see commit messages for more info)

title: Do MVV calls with Retrofit
label: [Label(name="Improvement")]
body:
fixes #977 

The `MvvStationListSerializer` is a bit ugly. 
@thellmund do you know, if there's a better way to parse schema-free JSON, then this?

I also added some unit tests, so the parsing should be quite stable...

When testing I also noticed, that `TransportationDetailsActivity` is really not great, since we're doing a lot of work in `onLoadFinished()`.
We probably need to switch that to a RecyclerView sometimes, so we don't drop frames like crazy

title: Optimize resources to reduce APK size
label: [Label(name="Improvement")]
body: The release APK size of 1.6.2 is 7.8 MB. By removing unused images and converting most of the remaining ones to JPG, I reduced the APK size to 5.6 MB. **Not optimized** **Optimized** --- We can further reduce the APK size. Android Wear 2.0 notifications no longer use the background image of the `Notification` ([source](https://developer.android.com/reference/android/support/v4/app/NotificationCompat.WearableExtender#setBackground(android.graphics.Bitmap))), so we can remove a couple of images used as notification backgrounds and get the APK size to around 5 MB. I will do this in #879. We might also try [Android App Bundles](https://developer.android.com/platform/technology/app-bundle/) in the next release, @kordianbruck.

title: Mockup: digital student card + mensa credit
body:
We want to create an activity that displays one’s own student card in the app and shows the mensa credit on the card. As we first need to talk to the Studentenwerk, we will first need a Mockup / XML in Android, that will showcase the usecase and make it clear that certain aspects are highlighted to the user:

- The credit is not "live" and can be lagging behind the real credit on the card. This needs to be made very clear
- There is no liability from our side, that the money shown is correct
- The digital student card is not a valid replacement for the analog version

Changelog *Sourced from [gson's changelog](https://github.com/google/gson/blob/master/CHANGELOG.md).* > ## Version 2.8.5 > _2018-05-21_ [GitHub Diff](https://github.com/google/gson/compare/gson-parent-2.8.4...gson-parent-2.8.5) > * Print Gson version while throwing AssertionError and IllegalArgumentException > * Moved `utils.VersionUtils` class to `internal.JavaVersion`. This is a potential backward incompatible change from 2.8.4 > * Fixed issue https://github-redirect.dependabot.com/google/gson/issues/1310 by supporting Debian Java 9 > > ## Version 2.8.4 > _2018-05-01_ [GitHub Diff](https://github.com/google/gson/compare/gson-parent-2.8.3...gson-parent-2.8.4) > * Added a new FieldNamingPolicy, `LOWER_CASE_WITH_DOTS` that mapps JSON name `someFieldName` to `some.field.name` > * Fixed issue https://github-redirect.dependabot.com/google/gson/issues/1305 by removing compile/runtime dependency on `sun.misc.Unsafe` > > ## Version 2.8.3 > _2018-04-27_ [GitHub Diff](https://github.com/google/gson/compare/gson-parent-2.8.2...gson-parent-2.8.3) > * Added a new API, `GsonBuilder.newBuilder()` that clones the current builder > * Preserving DateFormatter behavior on JDK 9 > * Numerous other bugfixes

title: Ticket Sale: feedback from PR
body: implement Till's feedback from #973

title: Fix wrong end time and timezone in calendar export
label: [Label(name="Bug :bug:")]
body:
This commit fixes two parts of the calendar export: 
1. The resource ID of the timezone string was passed as the timezone, not the timezone itself.
2. The start time of the event was also used as the end time.

title: Fix crash in MVVWidgetConfigureActivity
label: [Label(name="Bug :bug:")]
body:
This commit fixes a crash in `MVVWidgetConfigureActivity` which occurred when adding the MVV widget. It only occurred when the app was completely closed (removed from the Recents screen). 

**Reason**
In the constructor of `MVVWidgetConfigureActivity `, we passed `this` as the `Context` to `TcaDb.getInstance()`. There, we called `context.getApplicationContext()`, which will eventually invoke `ContextWrapper.getApplicationContext()`. There, `getApplicationContext()` is called on its property `mBase`, which is a `Context`. However, `mBase` is only set with `attachBaseContext()`. If we use `this` in the constructor, this method has not run yet.

title: Ticket Sale: pull-to-refresh to update ticket and event data from server
body:
## Issue

This fixes the following issue(s): #991

I made the getEvents server call use a retrofit callback. This is now used in the EventFragment to update the events and tickets on pull-to-refresh

title: Ticket Sale: automatically delete outdated tickets
label: [Label(name="Server :house_with_garden:")]
body:
This was one of the requirements in the SRS document. I am not completely sure if we still want this.

@kordianbruck Do you want us to implement this?

title: Fix crash in card widget
label: [Label(name="Bug :bug:")]
body: This bug was previously fixed, but the bug-causing code was accidentally left in the app. This commit fixes that.

title: Ticket Sale: integrated EventCard to CardView
body:
## Issue

This fixes the following issue(s): #980

## Comments

I integrated the events to the card view to the best of my knowledge. The earliest event is now shown in the MainActivity.
However, I do not have a good overview of all the interdependencies which I have to consider. It might very well be that I missed important cases.

The EventCard is not NotificationAware yet. Can we add that later if needed?

@kordianbruck Do you want this issue ready before the deadline tomorrow? If we are not sure if this PR could break something, we should maybe add it later. Maybe we should put the priority on finishing the remaining issues for the Admin app?

## Screenshot

![screenshot_20180714-121127](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/12066533/42723501-20caa292-875f-11e8-8c55-d3adad33a3ec.png)

title: Properly finish setup wizard
label: [Label(name="Improvement")]
body: This commit fixes #935. Currently, the user can return to the setup wizard by pressing the back button in MainActivity. To avoid this, we start `StartupActivity` in a new `Task` and remove the `Task` to which the setup wizard activities belong.

title: Fix NotificationAwareCard crash
label: [Label(name="Bug :bug:")]
body: We currently receive the 40 next departures from the MVV API. Until now, all these departures were included in the MVV notification as pages (for Android Wear). This caused a TransactionTooLargeException. With this commit, we only display the first five departures in the notification to prevent the crash.

title: Ticket Sale: implemented Pull-Refresh for Ticket Counter
body:
## Issue

This fixes the following issue(s): #920

## Screenshot

title: As/refactor ticket sale
body:
This includes refactorings of all kinds for the whole ticketsale feature, including

- rearranging of the package structure
- removing the ticket scan (will be included in the admin app)
- resolving todos
- removing unnecessary imports
- changing the date format to use DateTimeFormat
- etc

title: Ticket Sale: Integrate events to CardView
body: CardView is the main screen, once you open the app. We can supply an event card for that view so the next event is always visible there.

title: Ticket Sale: Admin - Set up main page Event Overview
body:
The event overview should be the entracnce point of the app.
Delete all ticket related methods from the controller.
Clicking on an event will take the admin to #919.

title: Ticket Sale: Revisit date formatting
body:
Do not use DateTimeUtils for user-facing strings.
Instead use e.g. DateTimeFormat.mediumDateTime.print(date)

Also check all event/ticket activities for any remaining crashes connected to date formatting.
When this is finished, also close #972.

title: Refactor MVV API calls
label: [Label(name="Improvement")]
body: We’re currently using our `NetUtils` to call the MVV API. We should switch to Retrofit and use GSON to parse the result into `Departure` objects. This will help us streamline error handling and provide higher stability.

title: As/adapt events add endtime
body: We added a endtime to the event class, and changed naming of "date" to "start".

title: As/include available ticket count
body: Since there now exists an endpoint for returning the number of sold tickets on the backend, I changed the client to use that data in the event details activity.

title: As/949 remove email from stripe request
body:
For the purchase and communication with Stripe, we need the user's email (lrz_id + "@mytum.de").
Before, we were giving this as a post parameter from the client to our backend on request, which is bad^^
We changed it so that the email is generated on the server (we have the lrz_id there after successfull authentication).

Therefore, I removed the parts from the Stripe checkout and the TumCabeClient that generated and used the mail address on the client side.

label: [Label(name="Improvement")]
body:
Currently, DateTimeUtils does not seem to consider Locale. The date format is statically specified as "yyyy-MM-dd HH:mm:ss"

It would be nice if the date formatting would be dynamically adjusted for the current Locale.

label: [Label(name="Server :house_with_garden:")]

title: TUM Calendar: Titles not displayed correctly in some cases
label: [Label(name="Bug :bug:")]
body:
Event titles which include multiple upper case letters or numbers are not or not completely displayed in the calendar. For example, "TUNIX 2018" is not displayed at all.
e.g."abc", "Abc", "Ab Ab", "A-Ab" work correctly. Problems occur i.a. in the following examples:

## Steps to Reproduce

Create a new Event with one of the following names
"A" ->""
"A-A" ->"A"
"tunix 2018" -> "tunix"

![screenshot_20180707-161120](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/12066533/42411700-6fc3f600-8200-11e8-8b08-d919c0e037ef.png)

title: fix event details layout and date display
body:
@kordianbruck If I remember correctly, in the last meeting we discussed that the date and tickets text views in the event details should be added to a horizontal scroll view to avoid a line break.

Futhermore, I fixed the date display. Before, 14:00 or 2 pm was displayed as 02:00.
I found that the easiest way to specify a date format is using getDateTimeInstance(int dateStyle, int timeStyle);
It is Locale sensible and offers some predefined styles like DateFormat.DEFAULT or DateFormat.Short

Here are two screenshots for German and US Locale

![screenshot_20180707-132815](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/12066533/42410438-c9dac39c-81e9-11e8-80b4-f64804c02ff8.png)
![screenshot_1530962689](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/12066533/42410439-c9f7c94c-81e9-11e8-9555-f32035770725.png)

This is a prerequisite for #920

body:
Implement after #965 
Also add the event duration to all places where it is needed. Primarily the addToCalendar() method in EventDetailsFragment

title: Ticket Sale: Add Event Duration to Server
label: [Label(name="Server :house_with_garden:")]
body:
Add a new field in the Event database on the server. This should then also be passed in the corresponding API calls for events.

The field should either contain a duration or an end date. What makes more sense?

title: implemented first version of adding event to tum calendar
body:
Events from the ticket sale can now be added to the TUM Calendar.

Open question: When the users click on the date field they should probably be asked if they want to add the event to the TUM calendar or the external calendar app. What are your opinions on that?

I also discovered a weird bug. Event titles which include multiple upper case letters are not or not completely displayed in the calendar. For example, "TUNIX 2018" is not displayed at all.
e.g."abc", "Abc", "Ab Ab", "A-Ab" work correctly. Problems occur i.a. in the following examples:
"A" ->""
"A-A" ->"A"

Any thoughts/experience on that? Should I create a bug ticket for that?
I could also reproduce this error on the master branch.

title: added a view additional changes forgotten in previous PR
body:
Some additional changes to the recent PR for the stripe checkout:

- changed the initiation of Stripe's CustomerSession and PaymentSession to be not any more parallel, but now sequential, because both request an Ephimeral Key from our server. In the situation that the Customer is not yet registered in Stripe, our server will for parallel requests eventually send two account creation requests to Stripe which would create two accounts (nontheless, only the most recent account for a certain email is used).
- added a check if the user name is set when entering the payment, since that is needed for the creation of the ChatVerification
- changed a string formatting method in the TicketType class

title: Fix NoSuchMethodError in Exam

title: Add network resiliency testing interceptor and improve error handling
label: [Label(name="Bug :bug:"), Label(name="High Priority :fire_engine:"), Label(name="Improvement")]
body:
We still have some `OnErrorNotImplementedExceptions`, which only manifest in on-device tests with shaky network conditions.

In this PR I tried to implement a way to test this in debug builds and reliably reproduce shaky network conditions.
For this I was inspired by Netflix's [ChaosMonkey project](http://principlesofchaos.org/), thus the naming of the network Interceptor.

Additionally, I already added some error handling for TUMonline requests, but I still get random crashes, when deleting the cache...

Unfortunately, the logs are relatively cluttered with the network errors...
We can maybe tune down the logging of network error messages a bit, to get a better look on the actual crashes.

If you want to reliably crash the app, set `ChaosMonkeyInterceptor.failProbability = 1` :tada:

title: Migrate TUMOnlineRequest to Retrofit
body:
**This is work in progress**

This pull request replaces `TUMOnlineRequest` with `TUMOnlineClient`, which uses Retrofit. The steps we took: 
1. We replaced SimpleXML with TikXML due to improved performance, smaller memory footprint and cleaner API. 
1. We added `TUMOnlineClient` and `TUMOnlineAPIService` for API access. 
2. We added `TUMOnlineInterceptor` to intercept requests, append the token parameter and throw exceptions in case of errors. This is necessary because TUMonline always returns 200, even in case of errors.
3. We removed `TumLock` and its associated DAO.

Building on these changes, we should do these things next: 
1. Update string resources with more appropriate naming. 
2. Update design of error layouts (nicer icons, larger text, proper headers).
3. Add TypeConverters (e.g. convert date strings to DateTime objects).

Issues: #544 #674 #388

title: Added color (accent) attribute to all notification creation
label: [Label(name="FeatureBranch"), Label(name="Improvement")]
body:
## Issue

title: implemented display of ticket types in BuyTicketActivity
label: [Label(name="FeatureBranch")]
body:
I integrated a dropdown menu to select a ticket type for an event in the BuyTicketActivity.
@schulzalexander and I discussed how we should implement the access to the ticket type data. The current model classes allow no connection between event and ticket type. However, a API call getTicketTypesForEventID exists.

The two options would have been:

1. Get all ticket types at startup and change the model classes to allow retrieving a ticket type for a certain event.
2. Get the ticket types for a certain event from the server when needed. 

We chose the second option as we figured it is easier to implement.

I am open to suggestions on how to improve the UI:

title: Implemented local database for events
body:
I implemented the local database using the Model-View-Controller pattern. I took the News implementation as a reference. I removed most of the static data which we previously used for testing purposes and replaced it by actual data which is fetched from the server. I still had to add some dummy data for testing purposes as there is not much actual data available on the server right now. I marked the places in the code with TODOs.

I understand that MVVM would be the preferred way.
I tried this approach using the Kino classes, (KinoViewModel, KinoLocalRepository, KinoRemoteRepository etc.) as a reference. However, I was not able to completely understand what is going on there as most of it is Kotlin and my Kotlin skills are ... still to improve ^^

This commit removes the MVV plans functionality from the app. As discussed with @kordianbruck, this is done for two reasons:

title: TicketSale: Pull to refresh for remaining tickets
label: [Label(name="Feature :tada:")]
body:
TS-Mi-3: As a student, I want to see how many tickets are still available for a certain
date, so that I know whether I should hurry.

The number of available tickets to buy via TCA is a very important info, that should therefore be shown both in the section of each event in the overview as well as the detail activity. This label should be updated via pull to refresh (especially interesting for quickly selling events, like Feuerzangenbowle etc.) by implementing an event listener to the database,
which is provided by the Firebase API.

title: TicketSale: Search student name or TUM-ID to find ticket
label: [Label(name="Feature :tada:")]
body:
TS-Ma-5: As a cashier, I want to be able to access the tickets purchased by a certain
student number, so that also students who have forgotten or lost their phone can be
checked.

As one student can only buy one ticket per event, we can link every ticket that is created during
a purchasing process with the student’s identity, i.e. name and TUM ID). We can do this by
building the respective database partition for the tickets as a dictionary that maps the TUM ID
to the ticket, as TUM ID's are unique. In case a student forgot their ticket for the event,
cashiers can check the name on the government ID

title: Ticket Sale: Send events to calendar app
body:
TS-Mi-2: As a student, I can add the event to my preferred calendar app, so that I can see it in context of my schedule.
Each event should have an “add to calendar“-button in its detail activity (regardless of whether a user has already bought tickets for an event or not). Additionally, we can add an icon for this action to the section of each event in the event overview (possibly a tableView), if there is still space for this. Once an event is added to the local calendar, the icons/buttons should change their appearance to signal that the calendar entry has been created. Clicking on the very same icons/buttons again should simply remove the event from the calendar.
Adding an event to the default calendar can be done by using the Calendar Provider, which offers a bunch of Calendar Intents. These allow to specify the action you want to perform on the calendar, in our case, add an event. When executed, this will take the user right to the calendar app itself, where they can still modify and finally confirm the event. Afterwards, the user will be taken back to where they were in our app. Using this approach, we don’t need the WRITE_CALENDAR user-permission in our manifest, as compared to the other possibility of just adding the event to the calendar without user interaction, which would require that permission.


Maybe something like this could also work: https://stackoverflow.com/questions/6617231/how-to-use-calendar-intent

title: Use architecture component's WorkManager
label: [Label(name="Improvement")]
body:
Instead of using AlarmManager, we should use [WorkManager](https://developer.android.com/topic/libraries/architecture/workmanager) to schedule tasks.

The current system relies on `BOOT_COMPLETED` and `WIFI_STATE_CHANGED` broadcasts to schedule services, which aren't really reliable on newer versions of Android.
Instead of working around those changes, we should rely on [the robust system Workmanager implements](https://developer.android.com/reference/androidx/work/WorkManager).  This probably also means to change the Services to `OneTimeWorkRequest` or `PeriodicWorkRequest`.

@thellmund maybe this also allows for easier Notification scheduling in #879?

title: Use Joda-Time instead of obsolete Java Date API
label: [Label(name="Improvement")]
body:
## Issue
This fixes the following issue: #906

## Changes
The main change is `DateUtils` -> `DateTimeUtils`, but should not have any functional changes.

I changed the data types in several models from String / Integer timestamps to proper `DateTime` objects, which should automatically be converted using the provided converter functions. And thus reduce the overall need to tediously convert Date strings.

I also changed the calendar weekview days to only show 5, otherwise the short dates would not properly fit the screen.

Sorry for the PR being rather huge, but those Date objects were used almost everywhere...

title: Fix crashes when device is offline
body:
This fixes the following issue(s):
Performing requests with Retrofit while the device is offline used to result in exceptions. This occurred when the `DownloadService`was invoked in the background. 

This change adds a `ConnectivityInterceptor`, which checks whether the device is connected to the Internet (via `NetUtils`). If not, it throws a `NoNetworkConnectivityException`, which can be reacted to in Retrofit’s `onFailure()` callback.

This prevented any crashes in my tests. Please give it a thorough review.

title: Add dedicated card layouts
body:
This fixes the following issue(s):
- A NullPointerException occasionally occurred in `TuitionFeesCard` when the TextView that was to be populated was not found.
- Generally, the way information was added to card_item.xml was too complicated.

title: Prevent crash caused by WifiManager
body:
This fixes the following issue(s): 
When starting a scan with `WifiManager`, a `NullPointerException` occasionally occurred within `WifiManager`. See [Crashlytics](https://console.firebase.google.com/project/tca-backend-0001/crashlytics/app/android:de.tum.in.tumcampus/issues/5ac7317936c7b23527adce98?time=last-seven-days&sessionId=5B1CD063022300023A092389244C668C_DNE_0_v2) for the console output.

We temporarily fix this problem by wrapping these calls in a try-catch block. In the long term, we should investigate the reason for the exception.

title: Fix bug that occasionally caused transport search results to be empty
body:
This fixes the following issue(s):
This fixes a problem where the search results in `TransportActivity` would stay empty even if the user entered a valid query (e.g. “Marienplatz”). It occurred because the MVV API occasionally does not return the "quality" property of a search result, resulting in a JSONException in the app. 

The problem was fixed by providing 0 as a default value in case the "quality" property is missing. While this no longer allows us to sort search results based on how well they match with the query, it at least provides the user with some results.

title: Fix crash in TransportDetails
body:
This fixes the following issue(s):
This fixes a crash that occurred when building the `MVVSymbolView`. Because the MVV API occasionally only returns "U" for a subway departure instead of the full symbol (e.g. "U3"), the app crashed while attempting to get the right subway line color for the departure. 

The fix simply provides a default subway line color for these cases.

title: Fix DB index error on first launch
body:
This fixes the following issue(s):
On the first launch of the app, we accidentally build the database twice. This results in a SQLite exception, as we attempt to create a unique index a second time. See #878 for console output.

This change fixes this problem by ensuring that we only build the database once.

title: Add intelligent notification scheduling
body:
## Issue

This fixes the following issue(s): #879 
- Move notification scheduling responsibility out of Card classes.
- More intelligently schedule notifications about the cafeteria menu, tuition fees and calendar events. For instance, cafeteria menu notifications appear at 11am on weekdays. Notifications about the deadline for tuition fees are increased towards the deadline, reminding the student to pay. 

## Why this is useful for all students
- Smarter notification scheduling provides the user with the right information at the right time.

## Notes
- `TransportNotificationsProvider` currently returns no notifications, as it will need to be further refactored to provide intelligent scheduling. In the future, we might show transport notifications 15 minutes before the end of the day’s last lecture if the user is at the location of the lecture.

title: Improve user experience in Settings
label: [Label(name="User experience :ok_hand:")]
body:
**Situation today**
We offer in-app settings that the user can customize. 

**Problem today**
There are some areas of improvement: 
1. The current design features oversized list items and text. 
2. Some preferences use the wrong kind of selection controls, e.g. checkbox instead of switch.
3. Some preferences don’t offer subtitles, which could be used to display the currently selected option. 
4. There is an odd animation effect happening when opening the _News_ settings, as some preferences are inserted dynamically. 

**Suggestion**
I suggest the following improvements: 

- [x] Switch to a `android.support.v7.preference.PreferenceScreen` instead of `android.preference.PreferenceScreen` for proper Material Design. 
- [x] Use switch preferences instead of checkbox preferences for preferences that are simple on/off preferences rather than multi-select. 
- [x] Add proper subtitles. For instance, the default station for each campus should show the currently selected option as a subtitle. 
- [x] Fix the odd animation in _News_ settings.

title: Adjust naming to match iOS app
label: [Label(name="Suggestion :telescope:")]
body:
**Situation today**
The app is currently named “TUM Campus App”. Due to this long name, the label under the app icon is truncated at the end. On my launcher, it’s displaying “TUM Cam…”. The Toolbar in MainActivity also shows the long app name. 

**Problem today**
1. Truncating the label under the icon looks bad. 
2. Adding “App” at the end provides no real value. 

**Suggestion**
We change the name like so: 
1. In the Toolbar in MainActivity, we display “TUM Campus”. 
2. We reduce the icon label on the launcher to “Campus”. As the icon itself includes “TUM” in bold white letters, user should not have a problem identifying the app. (The only thing that changes will be the app’s position in the applications list.)

Let me know what you think.

title: Add dedicated options button for card’s menu
label: [Label(name="Suggestion :telescope:"), Label(name="User experience :ok_hand:")]
body:
**Situation today**
When a user long-clicks on a card today, two things happen: 
1. We enter drag-&-drop mode, allowing the user to move the card up and down. 
2. We open the card’s pop-up menu, which allows the user to open the card settings or always hide to card. 

**Problems today**
1. This is an odd behavior. A long-click should not trigger two distinct behaviors simultaneously. 
2. While dragging, the options menu remains on the screen. 
3. Card options are not very discoverable.

**Suggestion**
We add a dedicated options button that opens the card’s menu. It can be displayed in the lower right corner of each card (not upper right, as some cards have a header image). 
This way, we avoid having two actions on a long-click and make it more obvious that the user can take actions on cards.

title: Uninformative NewsCard for new issues of Impulsiv magazine
label: [Label(name="Server :house_with_garden:"), Label(name="User experience :ok_hand:")]
body:
**Situation today**
In MainActivity, we show new issues of the _Impulsiv_ magazine as a NewsCard. 

**Problem today**
The card is not very informative. I only displays the issue number, but not the issue cover or any additional information. 

![screenshot_20180602-121158](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/11819826/40873312-55d01822-665e-11e8-9276-22317cdf17e9.png)

**Ways to fix**
We should display more information about the issue. For instance: 
1. Display the issue cover on the left hand side, similar to the cards about movies. 
2. Display the main topics covered in the issue. (Not sure if this is actually desirable, but let’s test it.)

title: Implemented server calls getTickets() and getEvents() on client side
label: [Label(name="FeatureBranch"), Label(name="Work in progress")]
body:
I started working on the client side server calls. I implemented the methods getTickets() and getEvents(). I have verified them with a local server using the static API endpoints.

I copied the data classes Event, Ticket and TicketType from the Eventsoverview branch to be able to test my code.

Some open questions for me are:

1. Should we use a controller like in NewsController or a ViewModel as e.g. in KinoViewModel to manage the data?
2. I saw that for other components @Dao objects are used. As I understand it, the data is downloaded from the server and saved in a local database. I guess, we should also use a local database for events, right? 
Currently, I save the donwloaded data in attributes in EventsController. Can I use this approach and add the local database later?
3. I did not really understand how to pass parameters in server calls. There are multiple options like Path for including parameters in the url or Body for passing objects. The following call expects two parameters which are not part of the URL
GET api/event/ticket/validate

Parameters:

    event_id (required) -> event that the ticket is associated with
    code (required) -> ticket code

Response { "valid": true }

How should I pass these parameters?
4. Related to 3: On the backend the methods get a $post and a $params parameter. What is the difference there?

title: Update behavior of Navigation Drawer
label: [Label(name="Suggestion :telescope:")]
body:
**Solution today** 
When the user selects a list item in the Navigation Drawer, we open a new Activity. 

**Problem today** 
When the user repeatedly selects list items, they end up with a stack of Activities. They need to tap back multiple times to get back to MainActivity. Also, these Activities have a back button _and_ show the Navigation Drawer when swiping in from the left. 

**Proposed solution** 
We convert all Activities into Fragments. When the user selects a list item, we perform a Fragment transition in MainActivity. Exceptions are About, Feedback and Settings – they can remain Activities. 

**Benefits** 
For the user: 
- Simplified navigation flow without huge backstack
- Navigation Drawer icon will be visible as an affordance all the time

For us: 
- No need to include the Navigation Drawer in every layout
- More flexibility for the future (e.g. introducing bottom navigation)

Open to discussion.

title: Refactor CardManager
label: [Label(name="Suggestion :telescope:")]
body:
## Problem
When I was fixing a bug in MainActivity (tapping “Open card settings" crashed the app for some cards), CardManager’s current behavior made it unnecessarily difficult. 

## Suggested Enhancement :sparkles:
I suggest refactoring CardManager and surrounding classes in the following ways: 

**CardsManager**
1. We update the CardsManager.update() method to return _LiveData_, so that we don’t need to take care of managing listeners ourself (also, lifecycle-aware 😎; in CardsWidgetService and DownloadService, we can use a CardsManager.updateNow() method to do it synchronously).
2. This can also help us to remove calls like `CardManager.getCard(index)` within the CardAdapter. The Adapter should be provided with its list of items, not request the appropriate one on every onBindViewHolder. 

**MainActivityViewModel**
1. We add a ViewModel that stores all UI data in MainActivity. 
2. This ViewModel performs the calls to _CardsManager_.
3. This helps us separate concerns and simplify MainActivity. 

**DiffUtil**
1. We use _DiffUtil_ with _CardsAdapter_ to determine differences between the old list of items and the new list. 
2. It automatically adds insert/remove animations, resulting in a nicer user experience. 

**Listeners**
1. We pass a listener to CardViewHolders that notifies the CardAdapter when a Card’s menu item was selected. 
2. This allows for a more streamlined reaction to “Always hide”, as this option should not only update the SharedPreferences, but immediately hide the corresponding Card.

**Open Questions**
We currently also update the cards on a swipe down and on connectivity change. I’ll research how to best implement those with LiveData.

Let me know what you think, @kordianbruck @jacqueline8711 @pfent. Are there other aspects that I didn’t mention here?

title: TicketSale: Add Functionality to do/undo ticket reservation when user enters payment process
label: [Label(name="Feature :tada:"), Label(name="Server :house_with_garden:")]
body:
**Reserve a ticket when user enters payment process. User will receive a ticket ID that they can use to perform the purchase later on.**

POST api/event/ticket/reserve

_Parameters:_
member_id (required): ID of student
ticket_type (required): ID of ticket type (-> implies eventID)

Response { “ticket_history”: $ticketID }
______________________________________________________________

**Cancel a previous reservation.**

POST api/event/ticket/reserve/cancel

_Parameters:_
ticket_history (required) -> ticket ID

Response { “success”: true }

title: TicketSale: Return list of purchased tickets for a particular user
label: [Label(name="Feature :tada:"), Label(name="Server :house_with_garden:")]
body:
**Get list of purchased tickets for a particular user. Return value for ticketList is empty if no tickets have been purchased.**

GET api/event/ticket/my/[i:user]/[i:event]?/?

_Parameters:_
user (required) -> user ID
event_id (optional) -> only return ticket for one certain event

Response { ”ticket_list”: { “$eventID1”: { “ticket_payment”: $paymentType, “code”: “$ticketCode”, “ticket_type”: “$ticketType” } } }

title: TicketSale: Return list of event suggestions for fuzzy search

GET api/event/list/search

_Parameters:_
search_string (required)

Response { “event_list”: { “$eventID1”: { “event”: “$eventID”, “title”: “...”, “description”: “...”, ... }, “$eventID2”: {...}, ... } }

title: Ticket Sale: Implement ticket check
label: [Label(name="Feature :tada:")]
body:
TS-C-5: As a cashier, I want to be able to reliably check the validity of tickets, so that fraud is prevented.

To enable the cashier to check ticket validity, the value that in the purchasing progress is translated to the QR Code of the ticket must be saved in the database. It must be ensured, that the client receives the same value as saved to the server. The cashier must be provided some kind of QR-Code scanner that translates the QR-Code presented by the students at the event and looks it up in the database. For that purpose, either a smartphone accessing the server's web-interface and using its own camera or a designated scanner device that can be attached to a computer can be used.

title: Ticket Sale: Admin should see total number of sold tickets for an event
label: [Label(name="Feature :tada:")]
body:
TS-C-4: As a cashier/admin, I want to be able to look up the total number of ticket sales for a certain event, so that event planning is facilitated.

This can also be implemented as a live ticker showing the current amount of sold tickets as logged by the server, i.e. using the same data source. This live ticker can be included in the admin gateway that we agreed on to provide in the server's web-interface.

title: Ticket Sale: Overview of booked events
label: [Label(name="Feature :tada:")]
body:
TS-C-3: As a student, I see an overview of my booked events, including QR codes, so that I can check the time and location at any time.
In the ticket sale activity, the student sees an overview of all events including title, date and time, which she or he booked. The next events should be shown at the top. The list can be updated by using the well-known Swipe-to-Refresh functionality. By clicking the event, the student can access the QR code, so that it can be checked by the cashier.

title: Ticket Sale: Handle purchase and send ticket data
label: [Label(name="Feature :tada:"), Label(name="Server :house_with_garden:")]
body:
TS-C-2: As a student, I receive a QR code for each ticket, so that the ticket check at the entrance is simplified.

QR codes are already used in many areas for mobile ticketing, e.g. for cinema or public transportation. The server should send the raw string containing the ticket data. The QR code is then generated on the client side from the raw string.

title: Ticket Sale: Implement Stripe as payment option
label: [Label(name="Feature :tada:")]
body:
TS-C-1: As a student, I want to be able to purchase tickets to TUM events using an online payment method (Stripe), because it will take less time and effort.

Stripe is chosen as payment option. SEPA, PayPal or other services might be added in the future but are considered too complicated due to external constraints for now. Stripe provides an Android library which can be added simply by adding a reference in the Gradle build file. 
Detailed information can be found at https://stripe.com/docs/mobile/android.

title: Make person details look fancy
body:
## Issue
This fixes the following issue(s):
- Design of PersonDetailsActivity looked outdated
- Touch targets (links, e-mail addresses, phone numbers) weren’t big enough
- Rooms couldn’t be opened right from PersonDetailsActivity

## Why this is useful for all students
This gives students: 
- More intuitive access to person information
- Ability to more easily find a person’s room

## Screenshot
![screenshot_20180504-125702](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/11819826/39624728-aef1676a-4f9a-11e8-9006-049136929c83.png)

## Steps performed
I took the following steps: 
1. Add dependency for 3rd-party framework for circular ImageView
2. Migrate UI elements in PersonDetailsActivity to something more in line with Material Design
3. Convert PersonDetailsActivity to Kotlin
4. Add PersonContactItemsAdapter, which is responsible for displaying all ways of contacting a person
5. Add AbstractContactItem and subclasses EmailContactItem, HomepageContactItem, InformationContactItem, MobilePhoneContactItem,  OfficeHoursContactItem, PhoneContactItem, RoomContactItem to encapsulate the contact information and the associated actions (phone -> call, homepage -> open in browser, room -> open room finder)
6. Add PersonGroupsAdapter, which is responsible for displaying a person’s groups (consisting of function and org)
7. Made changes that required other changes in PersonSearchActivity. As a result, switch from ListView to RecyclerView and convert entire class to Kotlin
8. Move code to save a person to phone contacts to a dedicated ContactsManager class

title: Migrate all Services to Kotlin
label: [Label(name="Suggestion :telescope:")]
body: We still have a lot of crashes in the background services. As a first step to combat this, we should move all our classes inside the `service` package to use kotlin, so that NPEs are no longer a problem.

title: Migrate TUMonline requests to retrofit
label: [Label(name="Suggestion :telescope:")]
body:
We are already using retrofit for our json api (tumcabe), but it can also handle xml based APIs.

We should move our TUMOnlineRequest classes to a retrofit based system, that allows us to use better caching with Okhttp and other unified tools. (RxJava, Room, Obervers, MVVM <3)

More on this:
* https://futurestud.io/tutorials/retrofit-how-to-integrate-xml-converter
* https://android.jlelse.eu/working-with-xml-using-retrofit2-21c3af9a0472

title: Upload obsfucated IDs
label: [Label(name="Server :house_with_garden:"), Label(name="User experience :ok_hand:")]
body:
The TUMonline `id` endpoint now gives us the obsfucated IDs for the current logged in user. We can use those to display the profile pictures in Chat and other upcoming interaction features (Study Cards :+1: ) to make the whole experience more personalized.

We need to upload these IDs to our API backend (tumcabe), so that we can deliver them with each ChatMessage and generally give the possibility to get a profile pic for any user.

There are several ways to do this:
* Augment the current existing API for uploading the chat registration to also include those IDs
* Add a new API that will allow us to upload IDs once.
* ???

Please look at the existing implementation and let me know what makes sense. (Backward compatibility and ease of use)

title: Make Person Details look fancy
label: [Label(name="Suggestion :telescope:"), Label(name="User experience :ok_hand:"), Label(name="good first issue :1st_place_medal:")]
body:
Right now the Person Details Activity is using HTML to format and display any details. This looks not as good as it could. It would be nice, to create a new fancy looking person details layout in material design fashion. 

Bonus points: This person details activity could be linked from the chat as well.

Don't forget to delete `HTMLStringBuffer` once you've moved to a pure android layout.

title: Configure picasso file caching
label: [Label(name="Suggestion :telescope:"), Label(name="good first issue :1st_place_medal:")]
body:
Right now picasso is only caching in memory. On a restart of the app, it downloads the images for new.

The goal is to configure picasso to use a file cache, which will be cleared when the `Clear Cache` option is selected from the settings.

Read more:
* https://stackoverflow.com/questions/23978828/how-do-i-use-disk-caching-in-picasso
* https://github.com/square/picasso/issues/1154
* Related #674

title: Cleanup gradle files and move configurations to separate folders
body: Doing some maintenance work

title: Same background across all activities
label: [Label(name="Suggestion :telescope:"), Label(name="User experience :ok_hand:"), Label(name="good first issue :1st_place_medal:")]
body:
I would suggest a unification of the UIs / Activity views across all views. Right now we have cards & bubbles over the really nice faculty background on the main and chat screen. I would suggest to use a similar setup in all activities where possible. 

For example the feedback activity currently uses just a plain simple grey background and no white card / box. Many other activities do not follow any guideline. 

Ideas? Suggestions? Feelings?

title: Make sure FCM token is uploaded
label: [Label(name="High Priority :fire_engine:"), Label(name="Server :house_with_garden:")]
body:
Right now uploading the RSA public key & FCM token relies on an activated token. This unfortunately leads to the limitation, that the app does not alert (Alarmierung) people who have not activated the app.

The behavior should be changed, so that the rsa public key and FCM token is uploaded on first start, regardless if a token has been activated.

Certain operations, like the chat, require a verified RSA key (this is done via TUMonline) - this needs to be handled separately.

title: Google Maps for TUM rooms
body:
* Elastic Search: backend solr, elastic search (elk)
* Draggable/Zoomable Map
* Map to Lat/Lon => Google Map
```
getMapMetric(m_id):

Returns UTM coordinates of a map plus rotation relative to the UTM grid.
(SW=southwest/lower left point, NE=northeast/upper right point)

Usage:
   getMapMetric(int map_id) =>[float SW_x, float SW_y, int SW_zone, float NE_x, float
NE_y, int NE_zone, float rotation]

Example:
   getMapMetric(12) =>   [690631.375, 5335887.5, 32, 691356.4375, 5336190.0, 32,
-21.271878999999998]
```

label: [Label(name="Suggestion :telescope:")]
body:
> Also, when moving to 21, we could also drop the PDFView dependency:
> 
> Also, an inline display for the PDFs would be nice to have. There is a PDFRenderer available for API 21+, even with an exhaustive example on GitHub. Then you can use the fileprovider as a fallback for lower APIs.
> 
> AndroidPdfViewer comes with PdfiumAndroid, which is ~16MB

title: Rework Wizard / App Setup
label: [Label(name="Feature :tada:")]
body:
We want to make onboarding for new users easier. In order to do that, we want to make the Wizard optional and less blocky.
The following should be implemented:

- [x] Directly start into the App, don't show the wizard before first load
- [x] Hide menu entries, that require the TUM token (Should already be the case with a boolean flag)
- [x] When not logged in, show a 'Login to TUM' menu entry, that will start the wizard with the existing three step proccess
- [x] Add a card, that is shown on the very top after installing, that additionally prompts / asks the user to login / activate the token

title: Issues with the reviews by TCA-Bot
body:
The TCA-Bot is leaving a lot of (annoying) comments. Maybe we can avoid some of those
- [ ] there has to be a whitespace after if
- [ ] the first sentence in a javadoc has to end with a period
- [ ] id is not used (even though it is used by a Kotlin class)
- [ ] Missing registered class referenced in the manifest (for Kotlin classes)

Resolves #586

label: [Label(name="Documentation :books:")]
body:
Currently [our Github wiki](https://github.com/TCA-Team/TumCampusApp/wiki) is based on ~articles to document some functionality and guides on using something. Mainly structure can be defined on a homepage or sidebar.

I've made some changes to the sidebar by proposing this structure:
 - General guides
 - Development docs
   - Component-wise docs
 - QA docs

*There must be a better way*
