title: Add test for database migration and versionize schema
body:
A simple unit test which applies the migrations on the pre-room database in-order.

I also wanted to use the [MigrationTestHelper](https://medium.com/google-developers/testing-room-migrations-be93cdb0d975), but Roboelectric just decided to be a PITA and fuck up the asset management, on which the helper relies. 

Now I don't automatically verify the schema, but just test, if the migrations succeed without exceptions :man_shrugging:

title: Improve german permission strings

## Issue

The german calendar and locations permission strings were mixed up.

title: Migrate all the AsyncTasks to RxJava
body:
There are several [pitfalls with AsyncTasks](http://blog.danlew.net/2014/06/21/the-hidden-pitfalls-of-asynctask/), most prominently the Activity leakage (see #697)

In this PR, I:
* removed all usages of AsyncTask
* bound the Activity lifecycle to the reactive observables with rxlifecycle, which ensures proper handling of device rotation etc.
* removed the ActivityAsyncTask used in the ExceptionHandler, since we used litterally 0 of the functionality it provided :man_shrugging: 

In a next step, we can probably remove a lot of the `doInBackground()` boilerplate and move everything to directly use Observables...

Tested everything and works like a charm :ok_hand:

title: Fix mensa widget empty
body:
- WidgetRemoteViews are not executed on the main thread
(at least it appears so) which led the observables not to emit.
- Add an additional method to Manager for creating a Cafeteria Observable
that uses the local repo and thus the default thread

Fixes #705

title: Fix a couple of AndroidLint Issues
body:
AndroidLint was getting a bit gnarky with over :100: issues :roll_eyes: 

Maybe let's try to keep that number a bit down :)

title: Move to SDK 21
label: [Label(name="Suggestion :telescope:")]

title: migrate the ChatMessagesCard to kotlin to fix NPE once and forall
body: fixes #700

title: add an OnConflictStrategy for TumLock Inserts
body:
fixes #699 

just replace the lock, since we only update the last lock time

title: correctly checking api (eduroam)
label: [Label(name="Work in progress")]
body:
## Issue
I think this should fix both #702 and #698 but I haven't tested it yet

title: Karte "Eduroam Reparieren" textuell überarbeiten
label: [Label(name="Suggestion :telescope:"), Label(name="User experience :ok_hand:")]
body:
## Suggested Enhancement :sparkles:

"Reparieren" gehört klein geschrieben, "Eduroam" auch. Letzteres ist ein Markenname bzw. Bezeichner der SSID.

Der Text "Identität enthält keine Zone ..." ist vermutlich für niemand verständlich. Das ist zwar jetzt nicht schlimm, aber ich würde eine Verbesserung vorschlagen. z.B. "Du hast eduroam ohne Angabe der Heimateinrichtung (z.B. "@eduroam.mwn.de") im Benutzernamen konfiguriert. Die Verbindung zu eduroam wird daher insbesondere abseits des Campus fehlschlagen."

body:
Alle URLs funktionieren nicht mehr und werden nur mehr weitergeleitet.

title: New Folder Structure
label: [Label(name="Suggestion :telescope:")]
body:
The App as it is, is hard to understand, as everything is really far apart and we have a lot of features packed into it. So I would recommend the following improved app structure:

* component
   * abstract
   * cafeteria
      * activity
      * controller
      * adapter
      * fragment
      * model
         * api
         * db
         * view
      * cards
      * widget
      * dao
      * repository
* api
* database
* notification
   * model
* service
* exception

@pfent @anselm92 ideas? thoughts?

I would like to get more to a MVVM approach of doing things. Remove any business logic. Get rid of all the managers we have and move that to repos / controllers.

title: extend thread sleep time
body:
This fixes the following issue(s):
When using the Chat with mobile data/wifi the message is not shown after sending it when the connectivity is too bad. By extending the sleep time from 1500 ms to 2000 ms it works even with a bad connection.

## Why this is useful for all students
Because the message you send should shown immediately after sending.

title: Fix clearing cache makes app unusable
body:
- Do not drop database tables but instead clear them.
Room can't handle recreation of tables yet and thus trows exceptions
when tables were deleted and not recreated.

Fixes #636

title: Failing test: kinoAdapterUsedTest
body:
## Steps to Reproduce

1. Run test suite `./gradlew test`
2. Verify unittest `kinoAdapterUsedTest` fails **after several runs**

Sample problem, as seen in the builds, [#223 failed build](https://server4.wdkk.de/job/TCA-Android/223/testReport/junit/de.tum.in.tumcampusapp.activities/KinoActivityTest/kinoAdapterUsedTest/) from #613  PR

This is likely only problematic within the test suite.

## Expected Result
`de.tum.in.tumcampusapp.activities.KinoActivityTest > kinoAdapterUsedTest PASSED` :100:

## Actual Result
`de.tum.in.tumcampusapp.activities.KinoActivityTest > kinoAdapterUsedTest FAILED`

## Problem
Usage of rxjava and robolectric. There is likely a race condition, as the test *sometimes* fails.

## Suggested Enhancement :sparkles:
Finding/creating a guide if we intend to convert and add test functionality in the future.

### Environment
* Phone: not applicable
* OS version: not applicable
* TUM Campus App version: 156b006 
* Language: not applicable

title: Fix sync
body:
## Issue

SyncManager's `sync` table is not populated with *sync* information from managers. On empty table, needSync always returns `false`, because **id** is not matched.

The following managers are using `SyncManager`:

- [CafeteriaManager](https://github.com/TCA-Team/TumCampusApp/blob/master/app/src/main/java/de/tum/in/tumcampusapp/managers/CafeteriaManager.java#L79)
- [CafeteriaMenuManager](https://github.com/TCA-Team/TumCampusApp/blob/master/app/src/main/java/de/tum/in/tumcampusapp/managers/CafeteriaMenuManager.java#L88)
- [KinoManager](https://github.com/TCA-Team/TumCampusApp/blob/master/app/src/main/java/de/tum/in/tumcampusapp/managers/KinoManager.java#L50)
- [NewsManager](https://github.com/TCA-Team/TumCampusApp/blob/master/app/src/main/java/de/tum/in/tumcampusapp/managers/NewsManager.java#L85)
- [StudyRoomGroupManager](https://github.com/TCA-Team/TumCampusApp/blob/master/app/src/main/java/de/tum/in/tumcampusapp/managers/StudyRoomGroupManager.java#L52) - **not sure what for is it using it, as it just pushes to Dao regardless and doesn't seem to use `needSync`**

## Screenshot

Not applicable

## Why this is useful for all students

Being up to date is nice

body:
## Issue

Partly solves #560 by converting NewsManager queries into Room persistence ORM.

DAOs are basically just used queries moved to Room's lib. I *believe* that future refactoring and optimizations could be applied for queries (possibly moving more logic into NewsManager) in the future.

This might look like a lot of changes due to LOC added, but most of it is tests.

## Screenshot
TBA

## Why this is useful for all students

Queries are only in their DAOs, which simplifies interactions.

## Why this is useful for all students

It reduces background data usage and of course battery usage when users aren't in munich and thus don't need regular updates

label: [Label(name="Suggestion :telescope:")]
body:
So this is something the TUM wants to have. The idea is a general Feedback option for the TCA for everything one can find at TUM. 

- Select what the feedback is about: [TCA, General]
- Add picture(s)
- Description
- Checkbox if user wants to add their mail als Reply-To field or anonymous. Default: checked
- Send a mail to it-support@tum.de

@jacqueline8711 wenn du heute noch Zeit hast, kannst ja schon mal damit anfangen. Deine Sitznachbarin im Büro kann dir dazu noch mehr Infos geben - sofern sie diese schon ausgearbeitet hat. (Fängt mit K. an ;]) Besprochenes bitte hier ergänzen.

title: First implementation of Room Persistency
body:
## Issue
see #560 

Currently working around our legacy database querying on the main thread with `allowMainThreadQueries()`.
We probably need to change this sometime in the future, since that's really not the best way to do it

Also: We kinda need to think about how we want to handle migrations in the future, deleting everything was 
never a good idea in the first place...

title: Improve MVV detail panel
label: [Label(name="Bug :bug:"), Label(name="User experience :ok_hand:")]
body:
## This PR fixes the following
- the detail view of the departures in MVV is way too condensed
- the departure times are inaccurate since the detail view gets its data from the card view (without refresh)
- very "light" colors that are not very well distinguishable in detail view (in my opinion, if you don't think so, I can revert it)
- long destination strings are cutoff
- fade-out animation do not work

## Screenshot
![screenshot_1511468101](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/3391295/33187850-23d180a4-d095-11e7-8d95-d0bc3ab48033.png)
![screenshot_1511468098](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/3391295/33187913-b12b342c-d095-11e7-9675-d7256f714c6c.png)

- way more visually expressive
- fixed departure times
- slick animations

title: Fix SecurityException when scanning for wifis
body:
On specific android versions wifiManager.getScanResults didn't
return an empty list but instead threw an exception. Check if
permission has been granted and only if so access scan results.

Fixes #569

title: Fix ISE in StartSyncReceiver
body:
Due to behavior changes in android oreo, services are no longer allowed
to run in the background without the application being in the foreground.
Change all on boot services from IntentService to JobIntentService which enqueues the service work on android oreo devices. See corresponding issue for more information.

Fixes #570

body:
## Steps to Reproduce

1. Open Roomfinder
2. Search for: "00.04.011, MI Hörsaal 2"

## Result
No room found

## Problem
The roomfinder does not find rooms with spaces. searching for "00.04.011" finds the room.

## Suggested Enhancement :sparkles:
Investigate, why spaces cause this problem. Maybe we need to specially encode them? Maybe we sould replace the spaces with wildcards?

title: Use Googles Room Persistency Library
label: [Label(name="Suggestion :telescope:")]
body:
We currently don't have an ORM, but write all SQL queries / mappings by hand.

Google recently released the [Android Architecture Components](https://developer.android.com/topic/libraries/architecture/index.html) with the [Room Persistency Library](https://developer.android.com/topic/libraries/architecture/room.html). We should probably use this, which should significantly reduce the complexity of our various "Managers"

```
<-- END HTTP (31-byte body)
```

title: Access Token configured properly, "Identity could not be accessed"
label: [Label(name="Bug :bug:")]
body:
This is not a bug I can reproduce on different phones but an issue that keeps me from using the app at all, so hopefully this is the right place to submit it ;)
Everything worked fine on the same phone before, then I reset it. I also applied the latest Android security patch (Oxygen 3.6.0 -> 3.6.1, Krack fixed) before installing it, but this looks more like a problem on TUM Online's side (at least I tried it ~10 times by now with the same result every time):

## Steps to ~~Re~~produce

1. Installed the App via Google Play
2. Started App, Startup Wizard is shown
3. Entered my LRZ ID, faculty informatics, tapped "Next"
4. In the browser, checked all five token rights, activated token
5. Tried to leave setup step 2 by tapping "Next" again

## Expected Result
The next step

## Actual Result
"Identity could not be accessed. Please check the rights of your TUMonline token" (Toast)

## Problem
When skipping this step and tapping "Go to TUM campus app" the following toast appears:
"Something is wrong with your chat registration", independent which boxes I check.

### Environment
* Phone: OnePlus 2
* OS version: Oxygen OS 3.6.1 (Android v. 6.0.1)
* TUM Campus App version: v1.4.9
* Language: English

```
    <obfuscated_id>6*D0780F2xxx</obfuscated_id>

        <student>5*F788EDBExxx</student>
        <bedienstete>3*F84C76D1xxx</bedienstete>
        <extern>6*D0780F2xxx</extern>

</row>
</rowset>
```

we can then use the webservicesbasic.personDetails to receive the users image

title: Use moar Kotlin
body:
Followup from #466

Converted almost all the models to kotlin data classes. Maybe take a look at the  `CafeteriaMenu` to see why Kotlin is much nicer there.
The Kotlin code is also much more concise for those classes, around 2k less LOC 🎉 

However, I noticed, that simplexml seemed to have some problems with those classes, so this probably needs to be tested to check, if some requests fail

title: Migrate the project to Java8
body:
This was made possible with the introduction of AndroidStudio 3.0 and the new `desugar` process

I mostly auto-converted a lot of the code, e.g: 
* using try-with-resources for all Coursors / StreamBuffers etc.
* converting all anonymous inner classes to lambdas / method references

Also, since this already conflicted with all other branches, i took the freedom to include reformatting all files in this PR. @kordianbruck don't already get nervous about that reformatting, I put that all in a nice separate commit, so you don't even need to look at it when reviewing :)

title: Update build files for AndroidStudio 3.0 / API 27
body:
Java8 language features and Kotlin. :tada: 

I updated the build tools and included googles maven repo.
Unfortunately, I also had to fix some build errors, like suppression of `classfile` warnings and hard-coding the colors in some drawables. Though, this shouldn't make any observable difference.

For the gradle files, I followed [Googles migration guidelines](https://developer.android.com/studio/build/gradle-plugin-3-0-0-migration.html)

title: Rethink caching / rework CacheManager
label: [Label(name="Suggestion :telescope:")]
body:
Maybe as a separate issue from [the iOS issue](https://github.com/TCA-Team/iOS/issues/156)

Our current approach to caching with hard-coded validities which don't respect cache headers, if there are any issn't optimal.
For okhttp, there is an [official guideline](https://github.com/square/okhttp/wiki/Recipes#response-caching) for simple HTTP header controled caching, maybe we can override this behaviour in some contexts and specify our own cache durations by extending the default cache.

title: Check if eduroam was configured by another app
label: [Label(name="Suggestion :telescope:")]
body: Android won't allow you to configure eduroam if it was already configured by another app (e.g. eduroamCAT). You should check for that _before_ you ask for the users credentials and instead tell him how to delete the profile manually.

title: Missing eduroam realm treated as insecure configuration
label: [Label(name="User experience :ok_hand:"), Label(name="good first issue :1st_place_medal:")]
body: TCA treats any eduroam configuration with missing realm as insecure configuration and alarms the user. A missing realm (username "go42tum" instead of "go42tum@eduroam.mwn.de") is not a security threat and shouldn't be treated as such.

title: Use EAP-PWD for eduroam
label: [Label(name="good first issue :1st_place_medal:")]
body:
LRZ now supports EAP-PWD for eduroam authentication. EAP-PWD is secure, only needs username and password, does not need any certificate and thus also does not force you to enable PIN lock on your phone to use it.
https://www.lrz.de/services/netz/wlan/anleitungen/android-pwd/

EAP-PWD should be used as preferred method for setting up eduroam.

title: Only show stations instead of any type (including addresses etc.) in MVV search
body:
## Issue

This fixes the following issue(s): #480

## Why this is useful for all students

In the current version, it only shows every possible match returned by the Elektronische Fahrplanauskunft of the MVV. Some of the items are addresses and points of interest that do not have departure plan attached to them. By changing the search type from *any* to *stop* we only search for real stations (like Theresienstraße or Untere Strassäcker). These stations are guaranteed to have a departure plan attached (so no more bad results and blank screens).

title: feature/285/WifiCoverage
label: [Label(name="Feature :tada:")]
body:
Implemented Android WifiScans for generating a wifi-heatmap.
This implementation was tested for a few days locally and proved stable.
It is necessary to merge the backend changes as well for making it work.
The basic idea is that every TCA user generates WifiMeasurements in 
random intervals. At home I've set the pause times to alternate inbetween
the range 10s to 2min and the battery consumption measured by my samsung
power monitor improved only slightly. In the current commit the timespan is set
about 3 times as big (until 7min) and therefore I expect almost no raise in power
consumption at all. Currently the accumulated scans are sent to the backend with
every iteration of the StartSyncReceiver, which is set to 3hours.
I've let the scans run for a few days and they also continued when the screen was turned off / app was closed. Some data generated for my local wifi (including my address :P) can be seen in the screenshot.

![database](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/15728390/27746825-01e05018-5dc9-11e7-80de-1b0c1bb069a7.png)

title: Study Cards
label: [Label(name="Feature :tada:"), Label(name="Work in progress")]
body:
## Documentation see [wiki/Study-Cards](https://github.com/TCA-Team/TumCampusApp/wiki/Study-Cards)

## Outline
For every lecture attending students can create study cards containing a question text and an answer text representing a front and a back side of a classical paper study card. Optionally a card can contain an image on the front and or back side. These Cards sorted by the lectures and by custom tags. Using this structure all students can see, the cards, search through them and edit them as well.
After the creation the students can use the cards to learn the content in a quiz style process. First they see the question and can think about it. After they pressed so see the answer they can give feedback whether they knew the answer or not. Furthermore they can give feedback about the content of the card or add a comment.
## Milestones
### Milestone A
Develop a model and a first simple backend API implementation. 
### Milestone B
Use the API provided by the backend to create a first simple frontend containing the creation process as well as the quiz process.
### Milestone C (optional)
Implement tag structure, editing of cards, feedback to the card content as well as commenting features.

## Next Steps
- [x]  add card title to model
- [x] rename user to member in model
- [x] add rating to comment in model
- [x] add/edit card mockup
- [x] quiz mockups
- [x] aggregated rating
- [x] mark card as duplicate of another
- [x] filter cards by creator
- [x] add tags in card add/edit/view screen
- [x] model active days
- [ ] Created at in edit and filter
- [ ] Add possiblity to show card or remove card in quiz
- [ ] Add possibility to add card or remove card in card view
- [ ] Settings wheel in overview becomes build icon (wrench symbol)
- [ ] Add creator to card item
- [ ] endpoint specification

title: Migrate the cache manager to also reside in cache
label: [Label(name="Bug :bug:")]
body:
moved the cache database to a completely separate database residing in the cache directory.
That also means, deleting all of the cache is as easy as a `rm -r cache` and we'll get no inconsistencies when users clear the cache manually.
<details>
<summary>Shiny new file layout 🎉 </summary>

#### Previously:
```
/data/user/0/de.tum.in.tumcampus
├ cache
│ ├ 1.jpg
│ ├ 2.jpg
│ └ …
└ databases
   └ database.db
```
#### Now: 
```
/data/user/0/de.tum.in.tumcampus
├ cache
│ ├ cache.db
│ ├ 1.jpg
│ ├ 2.jpg
│ └ …
└ databases
   └ database.db
```

</details>

@kordianbruck This probably interferes with your #444 quite a bit, so please take a look… I'm however quite certain, that the objectbox indexing of cached files would also break, if someone manually clears the cache, so this should be the preferred solution.

Also: Resetting the DBs now also stops al Services beforehand, so we don't get strange Exceptions with parallel long running Services

fixes #391

title: Get rid of SQLite - Use Objectbox
label: [Label(name="Feature :tada:"), Label(name="High Priority :fire_engine:")]

We should refactor our code and get rid of SQLite. It does introduce many problems with exceptions and migrations. We need to do better, for the simple data model that we have, the SQLite system is too volatile.

- http://greenrobot.org/objectbox/documentation/introduction/

title: eduroam assistant should check secure configuration
label: [Label(name="Feature :tada:")]
body:
## Steps to Reproduce

1. setup "eduroam" by hand or using TCA <=1.4.7 in a not entirely secure way
2. open TCA

## Expected Result

TCA should offer "update eduroam profile to latest security standards" (it may also say "Your eduroam setup is NOT secure, please update" but we don't want users get crazy, right?)

## Actual Result

_imagine some tumbleweed passing by_

## Problem

Lots of users don't configure eduroam properly and put their credentials on risk without knowing. They should be made aware of that not every wifi is always a happy place.

## Suggested Enhancement :sparkles:

Check users eduroam profile (if exists) against latest security standards (root certificate match, server certificate subject match) and notify them if the profile is not secure.

### Environment
* Phone: Any
* OS: Android 4.x+
* TCA Version: 1.4.7

title: eduroam setup should add radius server subject match
label: [Label(name="Bug :bug:"), Label(name="High Priority :fire_engine:")]
body:
## Steps to Reproduce

1. delete "eduroam" profile on your phone
2. open TCA
3. configure "eduroam" using the TCA eduroam assistant

## Expected Result

"eduroam" should be configured in a secure way according to the eduroam / lrz guides including checks for valid CA certificate and radius server certificate subject match

## Actual Result

"eduroam" is not configured in an entirely secure way, no radius server certificate subject match is applied

## Problem

Phone will connect to any malicious "eduroam" accespoint that issues a certificate signed by Deutsche Telekom Root CA 2 (which is actually not hard to obtain legally) and may expose user credentials

## Suggested Enhancement :sparkles:

Add radius server certificate subject match (you may check eduroamCAT App for details)

### Environment
* Phone: Any
* OS: Android 4.x+
* TCA Version: 1.4.7

title: Merge the Hackatum chat bot

During the Hackatum Hackaton a chat bot with speech recognition was implemented. There [an official presentation](https://docs.google.com/presentation/d/15UJRzb9DbSt-Gs11kjTdpVwBgNMBvHlDTT1iBQNVoEM/edit#slide=id.p) and a [devpost page](https://devpost.com/software/tum-assistent) showing the features.

It would be awesome to have this integrated in the app. The code does of course need testing and probably some refactoring, so this PR is meant more as a tracking issue than a real ready-to-merge-PR. 

Disclaimer: I'm not affiliated with the project. I just want to have this feature ;)

CC @camodude009 @dimart @rpadovani

title: Descriptive names in MVV departures overview
label: [Label(name="User experience :ok_hand:")]
body:
If you click on the MVV card, you get to a larger list of upcoming departures:

![screenshot_2016-11-09-23-21-40](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/3121306/20157072/611a5d2e-a6d3-11e6-878c-772683fcacca.png)

Names like _"MVV Regionalbus"_ should be the concrete route, like "230 Ismaning, Hirtgrasstraße" (this already is the case on the card itself).

Otherwise this view isn't really helpful, because the user is not able to determine in which direction a certain bus is going to drive. 
(Obviously this isn't a real problem with the subway when being in Garching Forschungszentrum, since every listed U6 is going to drive into town, but for other transport vehicles and other campus this is a problem)

title: Migration to minSdkVersion 14
label: [Label(name="Suggestion :telescope:")]
body:
Android 4.0 Ice Cream Sandwich, aka SDK 14 is now 5 years old, and almost all our users now use a more recent version of Android. @kordianbruck mentioned, there are only ~20 users left, that's <0,2%.

Here's a checklist what we can do, when upgrading to minSdkVersion 14:
- [x] Remove the NineOldAndroids library, that's been deprecated and not updated since 2014
- [x] Remove the usage of the deprecated ClipboardManager in InformationActivity
- [x] Remove the "@TargetApi" annotations in CalendarHelper, CalendarManager, MensaWidget, MensaWidgetService, MensaRemoteViewFactory, CardsWidget, CardsWidgetService
- [x] Remove the branch in OpenHoursListFragment.onCreate()
- [x] Remove the "@SupressLint("NewApi")" in MainActivity
- [x] Replace ActivityCompat.invalidateOptionsMenu() with Activity.invalidateOptionsMenu() in CalendarActivity, GradesActivity, MainActivity
- [x] Merge the differently flavoured AndroidManifests

title: Migrate CacheManager table to a cache only database
label: [Label(name="Bug :bug:"), Label(name="High Priority :fire_engine:")]
body:
Currently, we store the cache table in the normal database, i.e. it is located in `/data/data/de.tum.in.tumcampus/databases/database.db`
But the cached files are stored in 
`/data/data/de.tum.in.tumcampus/cache`

So, when the user clears the App cache manually via System Settings -> Apps -> clear cache, we get inconsistencies between the cache database and the real cache, because the cache directory is cleaned, but not the table in the database.

We can probably fix this by moving the cache table to a database in the cache directory

title: Add PDF Viewer to App
label: [Label(name="Feature :tada:")]
body:
As suggested by pfent in https://github.com/TCA-Team/TumCampusApp/pull/367 we should add a PDF viewer for the PlansActivity to directly display all the plans in the App. 

"Also, an inline display for the PDFs would be nice to have. There is a [PDFRenderer](https://developer.android.com/reference/android/graphics/pdf/PdfRenderer.html) available for API 21+, even with an exhaustive [example on GitHub](https://github.com/googlesamples/android-PdfRendererBasic). Then you can use the fileprovider as a fallback for lower APIs."

title: MMV-Plans feature
body:
- Created file provider to share downloaded pdfs with external apps
- Defined the file provider in the manifest
- Created FileDownloader help class to download the mvv plans from the website
- modified plansActivity respectively.

Please consider the following:
1. There is a new version of the document "Nachliniennetz" compared to the one currently used in the app
2. In the "Overallplan" we did not crop the rings only, since we are taking the whole pdf
3. Only the first 4 documents will be downloaded from the mvv website, the rest is not from mvv (we assume)

Downloaded pdfs:
1. Schnellbahnnetz mit Tram und Expressbus: http://www.mvv-muenchen.de/fileadmin/media/Dateien/plaene/pdf/Netz_2016_Version_MVG.PDF
2. Nachtliniennetz: http://www.mvv-muenchen.de/fileadmin/media/Dateien/plaene/pdf/Nachtnetz_2016.pdf
3. Tramnetz: http://www.mvv-muenchen.de/fileadmin/media/Dateien/plaene/pdf/Tramnetz_2016.pdf
4. MVV Overall-Network: http://www.mvv-muenchen.de/fileadmin/media/Dateien/3_Tickets_Preise/dokumente/TARIFPLAN_2016-Innenraum.pdf

title: update the instrumentation tests
body: This PR is primarely to test the Jenkins build of PRs and a possible fix for the NoActivityResumedException the Activity tests are currently throwing

title: Gather further statistical data
body:
Since https://github.com/TCA-Team/TumCampusApp/issues/359 collects the user's major already, we may want to use it to obtain further information on general TCA users, which can be used to improve marketing actions to increase the distribution in a particular area. Furthermore it's of interest to us and in terms of the alarming feature (cf. coverage).

The major may be obtained and transfered during the initial setup once, while submitting it from upgraded apps once, too.

title: Quiz feature
label: [Label(name="Feature :tada:")]
body: Closes / Fixes #359

title: Feature: Study Rooms
body: Finally, the long-awaited study rooms feature. See #231.

title: Improve Food Module with favourite food option
label: [Label(name="Feature :tada:")]
body:
It would be great to get a reminder on any favourite food in a notification. It may be specified by several search strings e.g. _strudel_,_nudeln_,_eis_

Further ideas (configurable)
- only if a person is next to a food station (3km)
- just for the current day or next day
- notification during business hours only

title: Organisation
label: [Label(name="Feature :tada:")]
body: The current implementation of the TCA's organisation feature does not provide useful information (actual name of person). It's required to modify gathered parameters according to the information provided in A. Bernhofer's email from Feb. 26th.

title: Fetch the MVV / MVG plans directly from the website
label: [Label(name="Feature :tada:")]

title: Quiz card feature for research works
body:
Sometimes research works including bachelor's and master's theses require to ask a certain group of people (e.g. all ones with computer science background) a certain question, e.g. "Are you familiar with ARM assembler?" or other questions types (multiple choice etc.) to add some nice conclusions to their work.

The idea is to integrate such a feature in the TCA and add it to the default subscriptions, while the TCA itself may check certain requirements (e.g. question requires CS student). 

Furthermore the self-administration needs to be developed, since it should not be moderated by us, too. For instance each user may ask a question once a week and users may flag it as inappropriate, which deletes the questions after a few votes. 

In general the person asking the question may review the results all the time, before the question is removed after 30 days maybe.

title: Consider using Jackson instead of GSON
label: [Label(name="Suggestion :telescope:")]
body:
According to these sources Jackson might come with a significant performance increase:

http://tuhrig.de/jaxb-vs-gson-and-jackson/
http://blog.takipi.com/the-ultimate-json-library-json-simple-vs-gson-vs-jackson-vs-json/
http://stackoverflow.com/questions/2378402/jackson-vs-gson
https://www.quora.com/Which-is-better-Jackson-or-Gson
https://www.reddit.com/r/java/comments/340m5q/best_java_json_parser_gson_or_jackson

title: Chat PKI confirmation leads to crash when key is not enabled
label: [Label(name="Bug :bug:"), Label(name="Duplicate")]
body: After upgrading to 6.0.1 and testing TCA there is a crash upon the chat key verification.

title: Code Quality
body:
We should think about implementing some more checks than just lint:

https://github.com/stephanenicolas/Quality-Tools-for-Android

Code duplication and other code smells are not handled in lint. Check this thesis for a comparison: 
http://repository.tudelft.nl/assets/uuid:bcba7e5b-e898-4e59-b636-234ad3fdc432/thesis.pdf

Also: some best practices:
https://github.com/futurice/android-best-practices#put-passwords-and-sensitive-data-in-gradleproperties

title: Convert project into a lib project
body:
Follow up to #352 after the recent PR

Everything should work just fine now

title: Present TCA at 33C3
body:
Requirement: full / better documentation

The idea is to present the app and its functionalities at the LT session of 33C3, since other universities might be interested in similar features and may reuse our code for their purposes. The TCA offers a great foundation to offer similar services at other universities, since they often don't have the resources for development.

title: Indoor Navigation (initial: FMI)
label: [Label(name="Duplicate")]
body:
https://c3nav.de/?o=wcc&d=catering
You get really lost here often :)

We need something similar for 1st term students. Anyone up for integrating it for FMI maybe? (Others may follow if used frequently)

title: Convert project into a lib project and add the two sdk target modules
label: [Label(name="Suggestion :telescope:")]
body:
This PR enables us to compile multiple APKs from the same code base. Instead of having a separate branch with the stuff for v14 we can now implement changes directly in the module for the specific target. This will finally allow us to deploy an APK with the widgets from the last semesters group and one which still supports gingerbread.

Furthure more this is an requirement for wear anyways, as we want to reuse the code when we will finally allow for a proper wear app. 

I followed this: https://developer.android.com/training/multiple-apks/api.html

@pfent @nilstk your thoughts on this? worth doing?

Please don't merge it yet, as it changes almost all files and would conflict the other prs that is open currently.

title: Feature prefrence appcompat
label: [Label(name="Bug :bug:")]
body: This fixes #348 and removes a dependency on a no longer maintained github project.

title: Feature new gcm
label: [Label(name="Feature :tada:"), Label(name="Server :house_with_garden:")]
body:
This PR fixes #349 and probably will help with #338.

From now on every device will generate a key pair on startup even if the chat is not enabled. Also it will directly try to register with gcm if it is installed so the alarm system works for everyone out of the box. 

Beside that I improved many details as there is no a central class doing all the work with signing. This makes it very easy to implement a verification of the device on every request in the future, which will reduce abuse of our apis. 

@pfent @brdvlps please test if you got any spare time

title: Rework GCM registration
body:
Our current approach to registering the App to GCM is handled in the ChatRoomsActivity, so users that did not start this Activity once are not registered. We probably should do this in the StartupActivity.

Furthermore, the GoogleCloudMessaging.register() method is deprecated since May 2015 and we should switch to the new Instance ID API (see: https://developers.google.com/cloud-messaging/registration and
https://developers.google.com/cloud-messaging/android/legacy-regid)

title: Settings: sub pages are missing the action bar
label: [Label(name="Bug :bug:"), Label(name="wontfix")]
body: also some activities are missing a parent activity and in such don't show the return button.

title: Update developer documentation
label: [Label(name="Suggestion :telescope:")]
body:
Since the developer documentation was not updated for a while, we should make sure to update existing technical documents to the most recent TCA version, noting down all links and sources (e.g. TUMonline API etc.).

Newbies: Please collect in this issue all questions and mention any problems so that we can address them in the new documentation.

title: Less lax rounding at "Next lecture in ...hours"
label: [Label(name="Bug :bug:")]
body:
**Steps to Reproduce**
- connect your TumOnline Calendar to the App
- wait until exact 2h before a lecture starts
- wait one minute

**Expected Result**
- App tells me, my lecture starts in 1h and 59min or
- App tells me,  my lecture starts in about 1h 45min

**Actual Result**
- App tells me, my lecture starts in 1h (compare attached Screenshot)

**Problem**
This is unfortunately pretty much missleading, as I'm mostly checking the time until the next lecture by having a quick look on "lecture starts in..h". And telling that the lecture starts in 1h even though it starts in 1h and 59min is simply wrong.
Btw: this issue appears every hour.

:sparkles: **Suggested Enhancement**:sparkles: 
- round time until next lessons up to minutes or
- round time up to 15min and set an "about" or "~" in front

**Environment**
Phone: Xiaomi RedRice S1
OS: Cyanogenmod 12.1
TUMOnline App: v1.3.2 
Language: english (I'm serious. it just appears to be german as lots of stuff isn't translated)

![screenshot_2015-10-21-09-32-17](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/11944529/11498864/4ff9f84e-9822-11e5-9fde-eef23df57ede.png)

title: Use vector images instead of PNGs for Icons
label: [Label(name="Feature :tada:")]
body:
Since Android Studio 1.5 and the Android Gradle plugin 1.5.0 came out recently, we can now use vector images instead of bitmaps for the Icons used.

I mostly used the [Material Icons](https://www.google.com/design/icons/) as an almost 100% drop in replacement of the currently used Icons.

This significantly improves the sharpness of the icons for High-DPI devices

title: Versioneye now supports Support Libs
label: [Label(name="Feature :tada:")]
body:
Just FYI:

I got the guy from versioneye to include the google support libs into versioneye. (They are usually not fetched from maven repositories) 

Check to follow any progress: https://bitbucket.org/versioneye/versioneye/issues/21/android-repository-support

title: Check bug reporting
label: [Label(name="Bug :bug:"), Label(name="Server :house_with_garden:")]
body: Since 1.3.X no bug reports were reported back to our system. Check why this happens and release fix asap.

title: iOS Version
label: [Label(name="Suggestion :telescope:")]
body:
I really think we should work on an iOS version! I can start but would like to know who wants to be a part of it. Plus I'm not sure of everything this app does, so I need someone to tell me everything before I start coding...

Who's with me?

title: Feature alarm
label: [Label(name="Feature :tada:"), Label(name="Server :house_with_garden:")]
body:
This brings in a lot of changes with GCM in order to allow multiple message types. In the future we will be able to send any client a notification e.g.: when a new app version is out.

The ChatClient was completely refactored to function as the new main work horse for any calls to any API endpoint on our server. Retrofit enables us to easily use certificate pinning and many other nice to have features, which we don't have to implement our self's.

The main core feature is that in not so distant future the fire department of tum will be able to send out notifications to users to warn them of gas leeks, fires or other things.

Server APIs will be switched as soon as we release version 1.3

title: Use an AlarmManager with SilenceService
label: [Label(name="Feature :tada:")]
body:
Keeping the SilenceService running to check for lectures wasn't a good idea to begin with.

The current problems are:
- If the TCA is killed, the SilenceService won't work. This is especially a problem on devices with low RAM
- The SilenceService is causing periodic device wakeups, which won't work with [Android Marshmallow's Doze](https://developer.android.com/training/monitoring-device-state/doze-standby.html)
- The TCA needs to keep quite some RAM to be constantely running in background

Switching to AlarmManager fixes those problems and thous should reduce battery drain

title: Replace AOSP Calendar with android-week-view
label: [Label(name="Feature :tada:")]
body:
The current implementation of the calendar is no good solution. The AOSP calendar code was not maintained since ~2 years.

In this implementation I am using [Android Week View](https://github.com/alamkanak/Android-Week-View) to display the calendar, which significantly reduces our code complexity (net change: -6000 LOC).

Furthermore, this resolves _all_ warnings being reported by the compiler.

title: Use Eduroam AccessPoint-IDs as "low quality positioning system" / Indoor navigation
label: [Label(name="Suggestion :telescope:")]
body:
The idea would be to gather data about room / wifi-access-points - correlation (on a server) to determine (on phone) when someone is e.g. leaving early and improve silence service.
see also #285

**Data gathering:**
- Integrated into some service
- When person probably is in a certain room (only 1 current lecture; midway; requires #300 to be solved), gather Wifi-Data of selected Networks
- Send Room ID and Wifi-Data to Server

**Server-Side:**
- Maintain a Table of Room IDs and Access-point-strengths plus input time
- Calculate Average of the _latest_ Data => Get Typically Receivable Access-points per Room (_TRA_)
- Provide API to upload Data and get the TRAs for a room

**Data usage:**
- When user should currently be at a certain room, get TRAs for this room from server
- Compare list to actual situation
- If correlation is small, assume user is not attending lecture; deactivate silence-mode

Some thoughts:
- Selected Networks would only include _eduroam_, _lrz_, etc... to improve privacy
- actual comparison on phone => improve privacy
- wrong data should not influence the average TRAs
- as old data gets dropped, any changes to the network should be reflected by the network pretty quickly
- the usual wifi outage could be problematic

What do you guys think?

title: Integrate WiFi coverage maps into campus maps and use the TCA to measure the signal strength
label: [Label(name="Feature :tada:")]
body:
The following website offers examples on how these maps might look like http://opensignal.com/

The idea is to integrate it in the TCA to aqquire live data on the signal strength of WiFi networks (e.g. eduroam) at various positions and collect everything in a map on a server.

For instance it might be of interest to someone to find the best spot in the university park with sufficient WiFi coverage without the hassle to run around and look for a signal boost. In addition it might help the administration to discover places that require better WiFi coverage.

The idea is to integrated barrier-free information in the maps like restrooms for disabled persons, special entrance possibilties for them or special locations e.g. baby-change spaces.

There is an app available, which offers some information, but lacks information like entrances maybe.
https://www.vmi.ei.tum.de/publikationen/apps/vmi-diversity.html
https://play.google.com/store/apps/details?id=de.tum.ei.vmi.diversity

title: Force close due to missing location information in calendar entries
label: [Label(name="Bug :bug:")]
body:
I noticed a force close when:
- viewing a non-empty day in the calendar section
- tapping on a date of an event which appears on the main/card section

After some debugging, I found out that the reason for this is a NullPointerException. It happens when the app tries to access the location of an event with an empty location field from the local database.
From my logcat:

```
de.tum.in.tumcampus E/AndroidRuntime﹕ FATAL EXCEPTION: Thread-1749
    Process: de.tum.in.tumcampus, PID: 30386
    java.lang.NullPointerException
            at de.tum.in.tumcampus.auxiliary.calendar.Event.generateEventFromCursor(Event.java:110)
            at de.tum.in.tumcampus.auxiliary.calendar.LoadEventsRequest.loadEvents(LoadEventsRequest.java:71)
            at de.tum.in.tumcampus.auxiliary.calendar.LoadEventsRequest.processRequest(LoadEventsRequest.java:42)
            at de.tum.in.tumcampus.auxiliary.calendar.EventLoader$LoaderThread.run(EventLoader.java:174)
```

I also had a look on the database the app uses. There weren't any dates with available location info, which is probably not the way the calendar table should look like.

Are there any other people with problems of that kind?
I'm using an OnePlus One, running CM11S (Android 4.4.4).

title: Kill-switch: stop specifc TCA versions from sending out requests
label: [Label(name="Feature :tada:")]
body:
A recent, severe problem seems to affect lots of actual or previous versions of the TCA. Unfortunately it's affecting our servers and the load is getting too high.

So far we can only kindly ask the users to update (if auto-update is disabled / usage of fdroid version etc.) via facebook maybe. In the current case an upcoming update has to be actually enforced (or the usage of the TCA blocked). 

For these (very special) cases we need an option to stop all running TCA services and block the actual usage of the TCA to force the users to update. An information message should be displayed, too. Of course, we should be able to select the affected version.

Any further ideas?

title: Fun feature for the chat - Quiz Bot
label: [Label(name="Feature :tada:"), Label(name="Suggestion :telescope:")]
body:
The idea is to add a quiz-bot to the current chat (fun feature).
It acts like this and is based on predefined questions.

10:00 Nils: !ask
10:00 QuizBot: Who is the current president of TU Munich?
10:01 Peter: Prof. Nahab
10:03 Nils: Prof. Herrmann
10:03 Quizbot: Nils was correct and got 1 point.
10:05: Paula: !results
10:05: QuizBot: Results: Nils 1 ; Peter 0 ; Paula 0
10:09: Kordian: !highscore
10:09 Quizbot: Top 3 - Rolf 100 ; Sabine 28 ; Rudi 5

Questions might be added by users, but need to be approved by us.
e.g. !addq _Wieviel ist 1+1?_2*

There might be several other commands e.g. !restart

title: API: Change chat API
label: [Label(name="Suggestion :telescope:")]
body:
Suggested API Changes:

For all APIs that work with ChatRoom:
- [x] Remove the field 'url' and 'messages'
- [x] Return only the number of members, but not all member objects

For all APIs that work with ChatMember:
- [x] Remove the field 'url' and 'public_keys'

createChatRoom:
- [x] Create the given group if it not already exists.
- [x] Add the user to the members of the list
- [x] Return the group regardless of whether the group was created or existed before

getChatRoomWithName:
- [x] Remove the API because with the change of createChatRoom it is not needed anymore

Also the registrationid is send on every join request... need to check this.

title: Printing from phone
label: [Label(name="Feature :tada:")]
body:
allow printing of PDF files from the smartphone to predefined printers (cf. UCentral) ; check if students can use it

https://ucentral/cgi-bin/login.cgi?print

title: Compare Grades with other students
label: [Label(name="Feature :tada:")]
body:
Ich habe vor kurzem von dem Service "GradeView" im Internet gehört, wo man seine Noten eintragen kann und auch innerhalb des Studiengangs die Möglichkeit hat anonym Vergleiche zu anderen Kommilitonen aufzustellen. 
Außerdem gibt es eine Verknüpfung mit Unternehmen, welche individuelle Jobangebote zusenden können usw..

Vielleicht wäre etwas Ähnliches oder eine Integration von GradeView in die App möglich, wenn die Notenverwaltung wieder funktioniert.

title: Encrypted Group Chat
label: [Label(name="Suggestion :telescope:")]
body:
So right now the group chat is unencrypted and anyone with access to the api can get all the messages. Suggestion is, to encrypt the group chat with a AES system and only save the encrypted strings. The key used to encrypt this, is a per room specific key which any user can get and will be send via the API encrypted with the users PublicKey (RSA).

Need some input, if this would actually help to prevent api stripping of all messages.

title: Chat: option to update message within certain time frame
label: [Label(name="Feature :tada:")]
body: It might happen that a user wants to delete a message that he posted by accident. For instance copy&paste actions, while hitting the send button (wrong message / unmodified draft). Nevertheless it shouldn't be possible in general. Only within a certain time frame of 1-2 minutes maybe.

title: Chat: provide ability to leave chat room
label: [Label(name="Bug :bug:")]
body: Currently also disabled feature, which needs to be reimplemented so that users can leave a room if they whish no more notifications

title: Chat: message verification
label: [Label(name="Bug :bug:")]
body: currently this is disabled, as it was not working. Should reimplement this feature

title: API: get my rooms
label: [Label(name="Feature :tada:")]
body: For the joined rooms, implement request to check which ones user has currently

title: MVV and Mensa cards not appearing when location  services disabled
label: [Label(name="Bug :bug:"), Label(name="Suggestion :telescope:")]
body:
It seems like the cards which are depending on the users location do not appear when location services are not enabled.

When the user starts the app he wants to see those cards/informations, so it would make sense to load the cards with the default Mensa and Location for mvv when the app can't get the current location.

title: Mitfahrer "Light"
label: [Label(name="Suggestion :telescope:")]
body:
The idea would be to extend the current chat feature in that way that we are using a chat room for announcing imminent car rides (on the same day only). All messages are deleted after a few hours automatically and sorted by an id (cf. showing interest). The meeting points are predefined by us and selectable by the driver. Also the pick-up time is attached. By default these rides should be free of charge or cost-sharing only (e.g. 1-2 Euro maybe). It's not possible to chat in this room nor to contact the driver. Just simple and straight forward. Nevertheless it's possible to show interest so that other users know when it gets crowded.

e.g.
TUM Forschungscampus -> TUM Stammgelände ; Meeting point XY ; departure: 5pm 
- Max Mustermann is interested
- Susanne Mustermann is interested

TUM Weihenstephan -> TUM Fak. Informatik ; Meeting point XY ; departure: 2pm
- Ulrike Mustermann is interested

title: Chat: cache entries and allow sending when no internet connection present
label: [Label(name="Feature :tada:")]
body:
We should cache all chat entries locally. Messages get deleted after a fixed period which will be set in the next meeting.

Also allow for sending messages via cache when not online.

title: DebugMode: show special information like API key
label: [Label(name="Suggestion :telescope:")]
body:
Sometimes it would be useful to get a users token if he agrees. Maybe we can implement a feature, where when he clicks on the version code in the settings 5 times the "debug mode" gets enabled, which supplies us with additional information. 

Concrete implementation is still open for discussion, also need to really respect privacy in this section...

title: Use okHTTP / maybe even retrofit for all api calls
label: [Label(name="Feature :tada:")]

In order to improve the usage of the api, we should implement retrofit on all api calls. When we get to parsing our own mensa data this will be mega useful!

Docs: 
- http://square.github.io/retrofit/
- http://square.github.io/okhttp/

Big benefit: we can enable gzip on all requests making the loaded data even smaller.

Add this to readme and Play Store app description.

title: add WiFi configuration tool
label: [Label(name="Feature :tada:"), Label(name="Suggestion :telescope:")]
body:
Enabling WiFi (eduroam) on a phone is always complicated for beginners and you need to look up the required settings usually. What about integrating a feature that requires the credentials (username/password) only and setups the WiFi automatically (see Android Course slides for details). Of course, the credentials shouldn't be stored at all. It just used one time to activate the WiFi network and then it's stored by Android itself. 

Also there needs to be a warning that users need to deactivate the synchronizing with Google in advance (!! / can we check for it ?) to avoid the transfer of their credentials to Google (cf. "backup my data" feature). This is important for every TUM/LRZ user and would improve the overall awareness for this issue, too.

Details:
"If the function "backup my data" is activated [...] This is a violation of both the password policy of the LRZ and the TUM’s IT user policy"
https://www.tum.de/nc/en/print/studies/studinews/issue-052013/show/article/31130//neste/1/

title: Update license information and used libraries (About)
label: [Label(name="Suggestion :telescope:")]
body:
The license information about used libraries needs to be updated in advance to our next release, too.
I noticed that some libraries were replaced recently. We should add all the names, their authors and the actual license text to the about information. Maybe we can hide the license details (Apache 2.0 text, BSD text etc.) in a sub-menu.

title: Cards: Long press should open settings
label: [Label(name="Feature :tada:"), Label(name="Question :grey_question:"), Label(name="User experience :ok_hand:")]
body: I don't know if this is a good idea, but long pressing on a card could open up the cards settings directly, similar to widgets on the home screen.

title: Initial start duration very long
label: [Label(name="Feature :tada:")]
body:
When starting the app for the first time, alot of content is downloaded. We might want to move this to the background service and show the user the app while downloading all the images. (As this is done by the background service anyway) On my pretty fast connections it took about a minute to download everything.

Also: we should show the user on the splashscreen, which task is currently being worked on - e.g.: Downloading event pictures...

title: Settings / Cards: disable completely

title: Integrating AnkiDroid: Learn Karten System
label: [Label(name="Feature :tada:")]
body:
Students of the Android Practical Course created the Android version of AnkiDroid some semesters ago. This might be a cool, new feature for the TCA and the introduction of a new chapter "Teaching/Research" in the TCA in general. Besides AnkiDroid, we might think about adding a survey feature, which is quite useful for all kinds of research works. Nevertheless this needs some further research itself (How to find participants? etc.).

Related links:
http://code.google.com/p/ankidroid/

Currently as it stands, the app is intended for students from the TUM but not really for people from the LMU or similar. We provide a lot of information which is not necessarily provided from the TUMO API itself. 
Possibly a good idea to open this up?
- [x] Rename Wizzard Button to: "use without tum id"
- [x] Hide menu items which require a token / id
- [x] Hide cards which require a token / id

title: Webservice: Feedback option
label: [Label(name="Feature :tada:")]
body:
Add feedback option , collect logs, comment and send it to support email (Add DebugMode - to view TCA's logs)

Nils: Thinking about us as developers it might still be an idea to add a raw view on the error log, since you cannot access other app's logs on new Android versions anymore without root rights (e.g. protected feature behind a password or after activation of developer mode by tapping a few times on a button maybe)

title: CurriculaActivity -> Links zu Plaenen aktualisiern -----> Webservice
label: [Label(name="Feature :tada:")]
body: As suggested by Nils, it would be good to use a server in between as a redirection service. This needs to be setup first...

title: person search: ss / ß
label: [Label(name="Bug :bug:")]
body: Replace special characters with normal ones e.g. ß with ss

title: When click on In-App-Tutorial open tutorial directly
label: [Label(name="Feature :tada:")]

title: Reeenable the "next lecture" feature again
label: [Label(name="Feature :tada:")]
body: Früher gab es mal die Kategorie nächste Vorlesung. Leider gibt es die nicht mehr. Die fand ich extrem praktisch, da ich immer wusste wo und wann ich als nächstes hin muss

title: Sync calender automatically Every two weeks
label: [Label(name="Feature :tada:")]
body: Currently importing the calendar into the Google calendar only takes two weeks worth of dates. Setup some service or something that syncs these dates each week

title: Translate to other languages
label: [Label(name="Feature :tada:")]
body:
https://crowdin.net/project/TUMCampus

Translate the app to more languages. Crowdin enables everyone to contribute

title: Mensa Widget
label: [Label(name="Feature :tada:")]
body: Show prefered caferia and food

title: Library Books: OPAC implementation
label: [Label(name="Feature :tada:")]
body: Integration der Bibliothek in die app. Besonders Konto Übersicht und opac Katalog

title: overlapping lectures in calendar
label: [Label(name="Bug :bug:")]
body: collisions / same lectures at the same time

title: TCA group chat
body: Once the deployment of the backend system to one of the chair servers is conducted, the server URL should be adjusted accordingly. This should be done in class de.tum.in.tumcampus.auxiliary.Const, and the name of the constant is CHAT_URL.

title: Close app on double back tap
label: [Label(name="Feature :tada:")]
body:
Please close the app if you double click on the return button  at the start page. 

That would be useful. 
Thanks

title: Praktikum
body: 03.03.2014 / new version

title: User Tracking with non-free software
label: [Label(name="Question :grey_question:"), Label(name="wontfix")]
body:
The app was just disabled in F-Droid, because it contains non-free binaries.

https://gitorious.org/f-droid/fdroiddata/commit/b516a20e1f932d5fa8c3a91e76b3a6b9163bb41b

This is probably bugsense which also spies on the users of this app. It should at least easily be possible to build the app without it.
